commit_message:
Include ansible commands for ansible linting

The plugin repo needs to be cloned for ansible-lint to
understand ansible plugins. The commands currently
reside in tox.ini under the ansible section and are not
currently included. This commit fixes that error.

Change-Id: I5bbd335eae52bfcf55fd915cb0389559a5654307

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-08 11:48:07.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_privsep/tests/test_daemon.py', 'oslo_privsep/tests/test_priv_context.py'], 'message': 'Fixes unit tests on Windows.

An exception is being thrown when tests are skipped if
the class name starts with Test causing the suite to

Closes-Bug: #1609782

'}]
commit_message:
Fixes unit tests on Windows.

An exception is being thrown when tests are skipped if
the class name starts with Test causing the suite to
fail. Changing the  name to .*Test fixes the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1609782
Change-Id: I8ef761a53737d82f1cf6288a655d014c98407e1c

commit_message:
Add support for Bulk Delete in NeutronClient

The following patch adds support for BulkDelete in NeutronClient.
Currently, the core existing Neutron CLIs are going to support
Bulk Deletion in NeutronClient. However, if any extension does not
require Bulk Delete, it can be disabled by updating the
class attribute 'bulk_delete'.

DocImpact
Depends-On: Ib23d1e53947b5dffcff8db0dde77cae0a0b31243
Change-Id: I3b8a05698625baad3906784e3ecffb0f0242d660
Closes-Bug: #1495440

subject: Remove deprecated exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 18:56:04.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/exceptions.py'], 'message': "Remove deprecated exceptions

Many exceptions have been deprecated since 0.10.0 glance_store release
and it's about time to remove them. This commits removes such exceptions
from glance_store/exceptions.py file . As there are no tests associated
with these exceptions, no tests have been removed.

This commit has been tested locally with the glance unit tests on py27,
pep8, releasenotes, docs test environments to ensure glance works with
it.

Change-Id: I24b4f8c56e60d1ff9fc970465fa155d01b349288
"}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated exceptions

Many exceptions have been deprecated since 0.10.0 glance_store release
and it's about time to remove them. This commits removes such exceptions
from glance_store/exceptions.py file . As there are no tests associated
with these exceptions, no tests have been removed.

This commit has been tested locally with the glance unit tests on py27,
pep8, releasenotes, docs test environments to ensure glance works with
it.

Change-Id: I24b4f8c56e60d1ff9fc970465fa155d01b349288

subject: Add required gettext package for compilemessages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-11 16:30:19.000000000', 'files': ['vars/debian.yml'], 'message': 'Add required gettext package for compilemessages

The Xenial gate is failing due to missing "gettext" package, which is
required for the "horizon-manage.py compilemessages" command to run.

This PR adds gettext as a package to install and should ensure the
Xenial gate now passes successfully.

Change-Id: Ib744121b002970e606b86dde4ed356184433cba7
'}]
commit_message:
Add required gettext package for compilemessages

The Xenial gate is failing due to missing "gettext" package, which is
required for the "horizon-manage.py compilemessages" command to run.

This PR adds gettext as a package to install and should ensure the
Xenial gate now passes successfully.

Change-Id: Ib744121b002970e606b86dde4ed356184433cba7

subject: Eliminate unneccessary patching in GreenFuture
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 14:15:07.000000000', 'files': ['futurist/_futures.py'], 'message': "Eliminate unneccessary patching in GreenFuture

Due to eventlet's bug eventlet.patcher.is_monkey_patched('threading')
always returns False, so it is better to replace 'threading' with
'thread', which seems to work properly.

Change-Id: I849e427c312e41b2d518a088e3f91c92d7574bd7
"}]
commit_message:
Eliminate unneccessary patching in GreenFuture

Due to eventlet's bug eventlet.patcher.is_monkey_patched('threading')
always returns False, so it is better to replace 'threading' with
'thread', which seems to work properly.

Change-Id: I849e427c312e41b2d518a088e3f91c92d7574bd7

commit_message:
Better utilize the L3 Namespace class

The Namespace class can create namespaces and enable
IP forwarding.  It also already initializes an ip_lib
class instance to run commands in the root namespace.
Change the DVR FIP code to use it.

Change-Id: I625c919af5b009999987382df64cd3491a932fe5

Run all bindep-fallback jobs on master

on changes to bindep's master branch. Previously we were only
overriding this for the project-config versions of the job.

commit_message:
Add -n to iptables calls

This change updates the calls that we use in the ocf scripts to
determine if the rules are present to include the -n flag to prevent
unnecessary dns lookups which can lead to deployment failures if dns is
unavailable.

(cherry picked from 28e3108dcf778f76899dc6b7f3a031ed8d6c6393)


Change-Id: I17d04fbad6def1217429fc3c92bed997fd510eb8
Closes-Bug: #1605540

commit_message:
sriov check for physical_device_mappings and exclude_devices

Since there is a possibility of passing empty array, the config
file will have empty values, erroring out sriov-nic-agent, we are
validating the array and only adding the values if it has values

implements: blueprint tripleo-sriov

Change-Id: I9500fc902809686a7f7c0b4e364a17a8ce922793

subject: Change construct_http_client to always use Session
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-11 19:47:29.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/client.py'], 'message': "Change construct_http_client to always use Session

We have the parameters in the argument list to construct a Session.
So rather than using HTTPClient if we aren't given a Session, always
construct a Session then pass it to SessionClient. That gives us a
consistent object later.

Change-Id: I2e29cd2fca716dab523d1d31cd4cd15c1d260b21
"}]
commit_message:
Change construct_http_client to always use Session

We have the parameters in the argument list to construct a Session.
So rather than using HTTPClient if we aren't given a Session, always
construct a Session then pass it to SessionClient. That gives us a
consistent object later.

Change-Id: I2e29cd2fca716dab523d1d31cd4cd15c1d260b21

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 22:59:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/namespace_manager.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_router_base.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_namespace_manager.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/namespaces.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Clean stale snat-ns by checking its existence when agent restarts

At present there is no clear way to distinguish when the snat_namespace
object is initialized and when the actual namespace is created.
There is no way to check if the namespace already existed. The
code was only checking at the snat_namespace object instead of its
existence.

This patch addresses the issue by adding in an exists method to the
namespace object to identify the existence of the namespace in the
given agent.

This would allow us to check for the existence of the namespace,
and also allow us to identify the stale snat namespace and
delete the namespace when the gateway is cleared as the agent restarts.

This also applies for conditions when the router is manually moved
from one agent to another agent while the agent is dead. When the
agent wakes up it would clean up the stale snat namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1557909

(cherry picked from commit acd04d668bd414cd21f2715adc6a35a0eaed59a3)

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Change-Id: Icb00297208813436c2a9e9a003275462293ad643
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Clean stale snat-ns by checking its existence when agent restarts

At present there is no clear way to distinguish when the snat_namespace
object is initialized and when the actual namespace is created.
There is no way to check if the namespace already existed. The
code was only checking at the snat_namespace object instead of its
existence.

This patch addresses the issue by adding in an exists method to the
namespace object to identify the existence of the namespace in the
given agent.

This would allow us to check for the existence of the namespace,
and also allow us to identify the stale snat namespace and
delete the namespace when the gateway is cleared as the agent restarts.

This also applies for conditions when the router is manually moved
from one agent to another agent while the agent is dead. When the
agent wakes up it would clean up the stale snat namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1557909

(cherry picked from commit acd04d668bd414cd21f2715adc6a35a0eaed59a3)

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Change-Id: Icb00297208813436c2a9e9a003275462293ad643

revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2016-08-11 12:55:21.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/validation-tool.rst'], 'message': "Spec for validation tool for Murano Application Packages

Murano doesn't have validation mechanisms for MuranoPL language and
application packages.

This spec proposes a validation toolkit that improves workflow
by making error detection possible at the early stages of application
development lifecycle.

Implements: blueprint murano-app-validation
"}]
commit_message:
Spec for validation tool for Murano Application Packages

Murano doesn't have validation mechanisms for MuranoPL language and
application packages.

This spec proposes a validation toolkit that improves workflow
by making error detection possible at the early stages of application
development lifecycle.

Change-Id: Iae057c87f014cc7151a38217c42f0e7e75f8037f
Implements: blueprint murano-app-validation

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-03 16:51:11.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/initiator/connectors/fibre_channel.py', 'os_brick/initiator/linuxfc.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxfc.py'], 'message': "Fix FC multipath rescan

Fiber Chanel multipath rescan uses wildcards for the host rescan, which
can end up recreating devices that had just been removed if there's a
race condition between the removal of a SCSI device and the connection
of a volume.

The race condition happens if a rescan done when attaching happens right
between us removing the path and removing the lun, because the rescan
will add not only the new path we are attaching, but the old path we are
removing, since the lun still hasn't been removed.

This would leave orphaned devices that pollute our environment and will
be recognized as down paths when the storage controller reuses the same
WWID.

This patch narrows the rescan to only rescan for the specific lun
number, and if possible it also filters the rescan by HBA channel and
SCSI target ID.

We only filter by HBA channel and SCSI target ID when we can find this
information, and that is when the FC storage servers implement a single
WWNN for all ports.

Change-Id: Id6ed98d3fb8b4b980de86256dec8eeda84562c98
Closes-Bug: #1608614
"}]
commit_message:
Fix FC multipath rescan

Fiber Chanel multipath rescan uses wildcards for the host rescan, which
can end up recreating devices that had just been removed if there's a
race condition between the removal of a SCSI device and the connection
of a volume.

The race condition happens if a rescan done when attaching happens right
between us removing the path and removing the lun, because the rescan
will add not only the new path we are attaching, but the old path we are
removing, since the lun still hasn't been removed.

This would leave orphaned devices that pollute our environment and will
be recognized as down paths when the storage controller reuses the same
WWID.

This patch narrows the rescan to only rescan for the specific lun
number, and if possible it also filters the rescan by HBA channel and
SCSI target ID.

We only filter by HBA channel and SCSI target ID when we can find this
information, and that is when the FC storage servers implement a single
WWNN for all ports.

Change-Id: Id6ed98d3fb8b4b980de86256dec8eeda84562c98
Closes-Bug: #1608614

commit_message:
Patch and post operations implemented for environment

Implementation of environment operations moved to library package.
Code for searching objects by ids and names extracted to the library
function.
Exceptions propagation added to example config. It is useful for
testing and troubleshooting to have error message not only in logs
but in the API response too.

Change-Id: I831981db6f032595aa5c388fc138b434a72811d7

commit_message:
Add development page with devstack

It turns out we never really had a document on how to work with
devstack in the devstack docs. At one point this was just cultural
knowledge passed down, but with the size of our community, we can't
rely on that any more.

Change-Id: I28f896ea507ccbba5164ebfc5415d22207f52e98

This spec proposes a set of new public core APIs for exposing the
system capabilities of a remote block storage deployment. For example,
it can be used to determine whether the remote deployment supports
volume backup operations.

Programmatic discovery of system capabilities allows Horizon UI to
enable UI widgets that exercise these capabilities.

APIImpact
We are proposing to add a set of new public core APIs to expose system
capabilities in Cinder.

Change-Id: I6c3a4ed00ec05e1b51063576b65a330be13d75ce
blueprint: discovering-system-capabilities
'}]
commit_message:
New public core APIs to expose system capabilities

This spec proposes a set of new public core APIs for exposing the
system capabilities of a remote block storage deployment. For example,
it can be used to determine whether the remote deployment supports
volume backup operations.

Programmatic discovery of system capabilities allows Horizon UI to
enable UI widgets that exercise these capabilities.

APIImpact
We are proposing to add a set of new public core APIs to expose system
capabilities in Cinder.

Change-Id: I6c3a4ed00ec05e1b51063576b65a330be13d75ce
blueprint: discovering-system-capabilities

commit_message:
Add fast8 ability to tox

This patch adds the same tox -efast8 check for testing pep8 violations
against future patches.  This is a bit faster, because it only tests what
has changed in your current repo.

Change-Id: I6eff6b5f57d947f8c1d0c832227d0f7e15d4bc6f

commit_message:
Add scenarios to VM

The VMPerf task scenarios can be categorized as a method for
validating basic L2/L3 functionality within an Openstack environment.
Users will be able to incorporate the test scenarios with other Rally
based functionality scenarios (Nova, Neutron, etc) in order to better
gauge the day to day health of a production Openstack deployment.

Update to include unit tests.

Implements: blueprint scenario-for-network-traffic-performance
Change-Id: I3d67aad67ac16a3443b8793fef509583f25023e7

commit_message:
Update keystone authtoken configuration pattern

This change updates our previous implementation of the keystone
authtoken setting to use the new designate::keystone::authtoken class to
do the configuration for the api.

Change-Id: Ib2a1d20d4e29353fc139835ce1c010a801506b9c
Closes-Bug: #1604463

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT: Add cheesecake replication support

Add ability to failover a given host to a replication
target provided, or chosen from amongst those
configured.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint netapp-cheesecake-replication-support
Co-Authored-By: Clinton Knight <cknight@netapp.com>

Change-Id: I87b92e76d0d5022e9be610b9e237b89417309c05

commit_message:
Fix adds a skip to the heat and live migration tests

We have to skip 5 tests to allow overall gate tests pass
This fix adds a skip to test gate_ostf_ceph_ha because
it runs ostf too, and the gate_ostf_update depends on it

commit_message:
Add gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge to nova experimental

We landed the os-vif integration changes to nova which broke
the gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge job which is gating
for neutron, so we should at least be running this job in the
experimental queue for nova.

Change-Id: I12f6b8ea21effc906ead97bee13f203667111220
Related-Bug: #1612281

commit_message:
Enable os-net-config to support and configure NFVSwitch

These changes are to generate /etc/sysconf/network-scripts/ifcfg-* and
/etc/sysconfig/nfvswitch configuration files for nfvswitch and its interfaces.
NFVSwitch is a virtual switch implementation based on DPDK for datacenter
workloads with very high throughput needs.

Change-Id: If02edb9c4c54c014f67290fe0c34e2fc73cb95bd

Using builtin open() in test code is not good and may reduce

When open() and os.path.exists() are mocked correctly, no need

Change-Id: I8bf2911545a755ebe4a63535ef8f7f9699460e9e

commit_message:
test_console_utils: using mock_open for builtin open()

Using builtin open() in test code is not good and may reduce
performance of the test. This replaces the use of open() with
mock_open in test_console_utils.py.

When open() and os.path.exists() are mocked correctly, no need
to mock _get_console_pid() anymore.

Change-Id: I8bf2911545a755ebe4a63535ef8f7f9699460e9e

commit_message:
rest: fix status test

There is race condition in one of the test as we cannot be sure that the
measures_to_process is empty: we use a common database/storage for all
metrics, so that might be wrong. Also, use assertIsInstance.

Change-Id: I3799efc24937ef20085bd807c9ba1689a7f87d34

subject: make neutron the default integrated gate set of jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 18:50:08.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'make neutron the default integrated gate set of jobs

The integrated-gate template is still very much nova-network
biased. Begin the transition towards neutron by default in the gate by
making integrated-gate be the neutron jobs (which is a tempest /
grenade pair).

A new integrated-gate-nova-net is added, with a set of non overlapping
jobs done with nova-net configuration. The grenade template is renamed
grenade-nova-net.

The nova-net jobs are added only where most likely to show real issues
(nova, devstack, tempest).

This shifts elements like requirements more towards neutron, which
seems appropriate.

Change-Id: Ie3a65d9b143ab0a4e4de37d925e3e0dc5c1da69c
'}]
commit_message:
make neutron the default integrated gate set of jobs

The integrated-gate template is still very much nova-network
biased. Begin the transition towards neutron by default in the gate by
making integrated-gate be the neutron jobs (which is a tempest /
grenade pair).

A new integrated-gate-nova-net is added, with a set of non overlapping
jobs done with nova-net configuration. The grenade template is renamed
grenade-nova-net.

The nova-net jobs are added only where most likely to show real issues
(nova, devstack, tempest).

This shifts elements like requirements more towards neutron, which
seems appropriate.

Change-Id: Ie3a65d9b143ab0a4e4de37d925e3e0dc5c1da69c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 8745, 'name': 'Lars Kellogg-Stedman', 'email': 'lars@redhat.com', 'username': 'lars'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18938, 'name': 'Anshul Behl', 'email': 'abehl@redhat.com', 'username': 'anshulbehl'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-11 14:59:11.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/teardown-nodes.yml', 'playbooks/tripleo-roles.yml', 'playbooks/teardown-environment.yml', 'playbooks/teardown-provision.yml', 'playbooks/teardown.yml', 'playbooks/quickstart.yml', 'quickstart.sh'], 'message': "fix teardown (tagging and ansible_user)

This patch fixes two large problems with our teardown logic:

(a) the tags applied to the teardown plays combined with the way we
were calling ansible in quickstart.sh meant that we never executed the
teardown tasks with the default `OPT_TEARDOWN=nodes` behavior.

(b) We were calling all of the teardown tasks at the same point, which
meant that the environment and node teardown tasks were being called
with `ansible_user=root`.  This meant that the node teardown in
particular was a no-op, because the libvirt environment of the stack
user was invisible to the tasks running as root.

With this change in place, I can successfully run quickstart.sh
several times in a row without error (previously this would fail
because the teardown tasks wouldn't execute, causing conflicts)

Change-Id: Ic94241c1d87b2dae335c6cb6627a4fdb5419482e
Closes-bug: 1610677
Closes-bug: 1610537
"}]
commit_message:
fix teardown (tagging and ansible_user)

This patch fixes two large problems with our teardown logic:

(a) the tags applied to the teardown plays combined with the way we
were calling ansible in quickstart.sh meant that we never executed the
teardown tasks with the default `OPT_TEARDOWN=nodes` behavior.

(b) We were calling all of the teardown tasks at the same point, which
meant that the environment and node teardown tasks were being called
with `ansible_user=root`.  This meant that the node teardown in
particular was a no-op, because the libvirt environment of the stack
user was invisible to the tasks running as root.

With this change in place, I can successfully run quickstart.sh
several times in a row without error (previously this would fail
because the teardown tasks wouldn't execute, causing conflicts)

Change-Id: Ic94241c1d87b2dae335c6cb6627a4fdb5419482e
Closes-bug: 1610677
Closes-bug: 1610537

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-11 14:59:11.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'files on undercloud had wrong uid

The use of the virt-customize `--upload` option preserves the file uid
when copying.  This could result in files in the `stack` user home
directory on the undercloud having the wrong uid, which would render
them un-writable.

Change-Id: Ia3c5349a5ed8bcecb96a633afc3be13b445b62f1
'}]
commit_message:
files on undercloud had wrong uid

The use of the virt-customize `--upload` option preserves the file uid
when copying.  This could result in files in the `stack` user home
directory on the undercloud having the wrong uid, which would render
them un-writable.

Change-Id: Ia3c5349a5ed8bcecb96a633afc3be13b445b62f1

It's good to know about things that client libs do to break us before

commit_message:
Add devstack test for shade and master of libs

It's good to know about things that client libs do to break us before
they release and break us. Add a devstack job config that installs all
of the client libs from source rather than from pip. This should usually
work, but if it breaks, it means there is something coming that we need
to be prepared for.

Change-Id: Ie387ab3f47d9f79f5d344bcd330784d49198e095

commit_message:
Configure Cinder default volume type

Cinder API now requires a default volume type.
This patch adds CinderDefaultVolumeType parameter, set to tripleo_iscsi
by default because it's the default backend in TripleO.
Also configure environments to override the parameter when needed.

Change-Id: I2a7f20475740c26442aa2735c7f438f64a579a0e

configurable [changes_interval] seconds
push: updates via the datasource's push notifications

Remove redundant method + Zabbix fix

1. Removed redundant method from drivers -
   get_update_method as it is accessible via
   configuration and there's no need for adding
   such a function.
2. Fixed zabbix get_all bug, zabbix alarms key is
   now comprised of the alarm's host name, raw text
   description and the trigger id.

Change-Id: Iab884a357ae7235e137600c95b0a23052cdee064
"}]
commit_message:
Datasource configurable update Method

Each datasource had a configurable field
update_method in the vitrage configuration file
where you can set it to update via:
none: don't update i.e. update only via the
periodic changes
pull: updates via polling the datasource every
configurable [changes_interval] seconds
push: updates via the datasource's push notifications

Remove redundant method + Zabbix fix

1. Removed redundant method from drivers -
   get_update_method as it is accessible via
   configuration and there's no need for adding
   such a function.
2. Fixed zabbix get_all bug, zabbix alarms key is
   now comprised of the alarm's host name, raw text
   description and the trigger id.

Change-Id: Iab884a357ae7235e137600c95b0a23052cdee064

commit_message:
RemoteFsClient extend Executor

This patch changes the RemoteFsClient object to be a child
of the Executor.   This enables it to have the same usage of
putils vs. privsep as the rest of os-brick

Change-Id: I89ed43dd87e137b939e141ea6c6c10129763d97a

subject: Fix incorrect Ironic functional job setting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 05:21:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix incorrect Ironic functional job setting

Change I57b886d62c2b6917d2cb0e300d1319d47477e578 was incorrect.
It added "openstack/ironic-python-agent" in python-ironicclient
functional test job configuration. But it should actually be
added to ironic functional test job configuration.

When we construct the environment Ironic functional gate job,
we got the following error:

The /opt/stack/new/ironic-python-agent project was not found;
if this is a gate job, add the project to the $PROJECTS variable
in the job definition.

This patch adds openstack/ironic-python-agent to $PROJECTS to
fix this problem.

Change-Id: I5f8edbd50b81c897c74beb4021becdaa930d3ea8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect Ironic functional job setting

Change I57b886d62c2b6917d2cb0e300d1319d47477e578 was incorrect.
It added "openstack/ironic-python-agent" in python-ironicclient
functional test job configuration. But it should actually be
added to ironic functional test job configuration.

When we construct the environment Ironic functional gate job,
we got the following error:

The /opt/stack/new/ironic-python-agent project was not found;
if this is a gate job, add the project to the $PROJECTS variable
in the job definition.

This patch adds openstack/ironic-python-agent to $PROJECTS to
fix this problem.

Change-Id: I5f8edbd50b81c897c74beb4021becdaa930d3ea8

commit_message:
panko: fix py34 gating

Commit f2d43b1deb9d074c6737a01777076bdf31e44c7c broke Panko gate as it
made it run Python 3.4 tests on Xenial, where python3.4 is not
available.

This patches remove Python 3.4 job as we don't really care as long as we
have Python 3.5 support.

Change-Id: I64285000828df2bc84fef1eda64179174dcedc4c

subject: Bump keystoneclient to 2.0.0
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 14288, 'name': 'Matthew Thode', 'display_name': 'prometheanfire', 'email': 'mthode@mthode.org', 'username': 'prometheanfire'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-10 13:17:51.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Bump keystoneclient to 2.0.0

Latest version is 3.4.0

keystoneclient < 2.0.0 has a bug related to discovery keystone version
while using session object. It was fixed in 2.0.0 with
  https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/d9031c252848d89270a543b67109a46f9c505c86

You can name it as a feature for keystoneclient >= 2.0.0 instead of a bug for
keystoneclient <2.0.0 , but it will not change nothing: interface of old
keystoneclient is different from new one, so let's bump keystoneclient
version to have equal interface in whole supported versions

Related-Bug: #1513839

Change-Id: I6cb1a4646a03715fedaa5075c9c3aedcf2d7184f
"}]
commit_message:
Bump keystoneclient to 2.0.0

Latest version is 3.4.0

keystoneclient < 2.0.0 has a bug related to discovery keystone version
while using session object. It was fixed in 2.0.0 with
  https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/commit/d9031c252848d89270a543b67109a46f9c505c86

You can name it as a feature for keystoneclient >= 2.0.0 instead of a bug for
keystoneclient <2.0.0 , but it will not change nothing: interface of old
keystoneclient is different from new one, so let's bump keystoneclient
version to have equal interface in whole supported versions

Related-Bug: #1513839

Change-Id: I6cb1a4646a03715fedaa5075c9c3aedcf2d7184f

commit_message:
swift-ring-builder output corrected for ipv6

Adjusted width of ip and port columns in swift-ring-builder command
output to dynamically span to the longest ip or the longest port in
the devices list. Also combined the port and ip address columns for
better visual clarity. Took care of ipv6 format [ipv6]:port

Modified the corresponding test case with expected output.

Change-Id: I65837f8fed70be60b53d5a817a4ce529ad0f070e
Closes-Bug: #1567105

subject: Add test class to versions tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 8158, 'name': 'Hemanth Makkapati', 'email': 'makstacker+osgerrit@gmail.com', 'username': 'hemanth.makkapati'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 17116, 'name': 'Niall Bunting', 'email': 'niall.bunting@hpe.com', 'username': 'NiallBunting'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-08-10 23:10:21.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/test_versions.py'], 'message': "Add test class to versions tests

The current versions tests contain a class to test the versions
response, and a class to test version negotiation, but this put us
in a situation where the 'versions' response was correctly updated
for v2.3, but the negotiation to map v2.3 -> v2 was not, thereby
making calls to /v2.3/whatever fail even though all tests in both
classes passed.

This patch adds a new test class that inherits from both of the
current test classes.  It contains tests to verify that all the
versions mentioned in the versions response are mapped correctly
so this kind of partial update situation won't happen again.

Partial-Bug: #1609571
Change-Id: I9e93b0f075eb6129c912dfca0a5d005f71bbc253
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Komawar <nik.komawar@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brian Rosmaita <brian.rosmaita@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add test class to versions tests

The current versions tests contain a class to test the versions
response, and a class to test version negotiation, but this put us
in a situation where the 'versions' response was correctly updated
for v2.3, but the negotiation to map v2.3 -> v2 was not, thereby
making calls to /v2.3/whatever fail even though all tests in both
classes passed.

This patch adds a new test class that inherits from both of the
current test classes.  It contains tests to verify that all the
versions mentioned in the versions response are mapped correctly
so this kind of partial update situation won't happen again.

Partial-Bug: #1609571
Change-Id: I9e93b0f075eb6129c912dfca0a5d005f71bbc253
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Komawar <nik.komawar@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brian Rosmaita <brian.rosmaita@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix SSL/TLS verification for network commands
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 14:53:10.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1560157-bce572f58b43efa1.yaml', 'openstackclient/network/client.py'], 'message': 'Fix SSL/TLS verification for network commands

The network commands ignored the --insecure and --os-cacert
options and OS_CACERT environment variable which prevented
them from properly completing SSL/TLS verification. This
resulted in the network commands failing with
"An SSL error occurred."

Change-Id: I15167631ef58335e1476c16b828b079e3b0f13c1
Closes-Bug: #1560157
'}]
commit_message:
Fix SSL/TLS verification for network commands

The network commands ignored the --insecure and --os-cacert
options and OS_CACERT environment variable which prevented
them from properly completing SSL/TLS verification. This
resulted in the network commands failing with
"An SSL error occurred."

Change-Id: I15167631ef58335e1476c16b828b079e3b0f13c1
Closes-Bug: #1560157

commit_message:
Cleanup/standardize usage of tags

The numerous tags within the role have been condensed
to two tags: swift-install and swift-config

These tags have been chosen as they are namespaced
and cover the two major functions of the role.

Change-Id: I7d73d4b0eaa32c3f8bd9895aeb70781a80e7ab8f

Change-Id: Ib951680917a3cda8c44d237c63d3ef2c09aa0057

commit_message:
libvirt: convert over to use os-vif for Linux Bridge & OVS

This converts the libvirt VIF handler class to call out to
os-vif for plugging/unplugging the Linux Bridge and OpenVSwitch
VIF types.

This should provide identical functionality that which exists
today, allowing seemless upgrade. The new os-vif plugins have
some config parameters in a new section, however, the os-vif
config params have suitable deprecated annotations to ensure
they will pull values from the old names/groups in the config
file.

Blueprint: os-vif-library
Change-Id: Ib951680917a3cda8c44d237c63d3ef2c09aa0057

commit_message:
Fix designate bootstrap.

According to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/designate/getting-started.html#initialize-start-the-central-service
designate database bootstrap to be done by designate-manage database sync.
Was also missing designate-manage pool_manager_cache sync.
designate-manage command is packaged with designate-central.
Boot strap commands moved to designate-central.
Added creation of log directories.
Added python2-oslo-reports and python2-suds for bootstrap to complete.

Change-Id: I3896064b0abb31c96307b16005a340fc193aac3c
Closes-Bug: 1610795

lxc-container-create role as this preparation is required
to be done for all containers and is not unique for each
container.

commit_message:
Add tests for component registry suite for vCenter

With component registry mechanism plugins can set compatibility,
incompatibility and requires between components.

Current tests implement automatization to verify UI representation of
components relations. They have to be run regularly on CI.

To run tests you need to export variables PLUGIN_RPM (path to
example-plugin rpm) and VENV (path to virtual env). Run with
`npm run component-tests`.

Closes-Bug: #1597710
Change-Id: I5d929da714a4c44515094df4e6edd3a7d93f4aa0

commit_message:
Make ovn-install-kuryr job voting

The gate-install-dsvm-networking-ovn-kuryr-nv job has a very high
success rate (logstash data shows hasn't failed at all in the
last 9 days and 46 runs, which is as far as it keeps data for),
so this patch makes it voting.

commit_message:
Update dnsmasq for additional networks

This change includes an updated listen-address configuration for the
additional admin networks that can be configured.  This change looks
through the puppet facts to try and identify which interface is
configured for the extra admin network and uses the ip address that
exists in the admin network cidr as a listen-address for dnsmasq

Change-Id: I3322b4e945d3bd016a2c1977dc89c2227735b2e8
Closes-Bug: #1606914

subject: Added revert to delete LPAR from destination host on failed rebuild
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-10 20:19:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/tasks/vm.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/tasks/test_vm.py'], 'message': 'Added revert to delete LPAR from destination host on failed rebuild

This change adds a revert method to the Create task. Originally
there was no revert task for this method because LPAR cleanup
was handled elsewhere on a failed build. On rebuilds however,
this cleanup code was not being run because new builds and
rebuilds follow different flows. This was causing future
rebuilds to fail, because it appeared that the LPAR was already
on the destination host. The added revert method checks to
confirm that the failed build was a rebuild, and if it was,
it removes the LPAR off the destination host.

Change-Id: I56bae7e545f56d1fdf455309d11f24b61b0a9a1c
Closes-Bug: #1596797
'}]
commit_message:
Added revert to delete LPAR from destination host on failed rebuild

This change adds a revert method to the Create task. Originally
there was no revert task for this method because LPAR cleanup
was handled elsewhere on a failed build. On rebuilds however,
this cleanup code was not being run because new builds and
rebuilds follow different flows. This was causing future
rebuilds to fail, because it appeared that the LPAR was already
on the destination host. The added revert method checks to
confirm that the failed build was a rebuild, and if it was,
it removes the LPAR off the destination host.

Change-Id: I56bae7e545f56d1fdf455309d11f24b61b0a9a1c
Closes-Bug: #1596797

subject: go: make moveparts work for both kinds of ring change
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-09 20:43:27.000000000', 'files': ['go/objectserver/replicator_test.go', 'go/objectserver/priorityrep_test.go', 'go/probe/base.go', 'go/hummingbird/ring.go', 'go/objectserver/priorityrep.go'], 'message': 'go: make moveparts work for both kinds of ring change

here are the two cases:

(this is what moveparts used to do)
For use when adding new capacity to a cluster. Will move partitions
from the nodes they were removed from to their new home.

and now it does this too:
For use when recovering from a ring change due to failed drives.
Will populate new partitions from their unchanged peer partitions
i.e., will not call replication from the failed drives.

Change-Id: I6f0760ed3060ad02c553eabff0d17944efe2c1fb
'}]
commit_message:
go: make moveparts work for both kinds of ring change

here are the two cases:

(this is what moveparts used to do)
For use when adding new capacity to a cluster. Will move partitions
from the nodes they were removed from to their new home.

and now it does this too:
For use when recovering from a ring change due to failed drives.
Will populate new partitions from their unchanged peer partitions
i.e., will not call replication from the failed drives.

Change-Id: I6f0760ed3060ad02c553eabff0d17944efe2c1fb

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 8978, 'name': 'Marek Denis', 'email': 'marek.denis+openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'marek-denis'}, {'_account_id': 13063, 'name': 'WEI CHEN', 'email': 'dave.jungler@gmail.com', 'username': 'wei.d.chen'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-03 21:41:38.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/conf/default.py', 'keystone/common/sql/core.py', 'keystone/exception.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_sql.py'], 'message': "Introduce read-only mode for the database

One of the outcomes of the keystone midcycle was the idea for a
read-only mode, which would allow keystone to continue serving 99% of
keystone's real world usage patterns (and possibly 100% during a rolling
upgrade process), while the underlying database schema is being live
migrated.

With this feature, old code could continue to read from an expanded, or
even partially migrated, database without interfering in the upgrade
process by racing the data migration process, and the new code does not
have to know how to read and write two different schemas (and any
partial variations in between).

Change-Id: Ica1e438ca3b1f73eaf697046b4e2cf01f3a8b859
bp manage-migration
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce read-only mode for the database

One of the outcomes of the keystone midcycle was the idea for a
read-only mode, which would allow keystone to continue serving 99% of
keystone's real world usage patterns (and possibly 100% during a rolling
upgrade process), while the underlying database schema is being live
migrated.

With this feature, old code could continue to read from an expanded, or
even partially migrated, database without interfering in the upgrade
process by racing the data migration process, and the new code does not
have to know how to read and write two different schemas (and any
partial variations in between).

Change-Id: Ica1e438ca3b1f73eaf697046b4e2cf01f3a8b859
bp manage-migration

subject: Re: Remove dependency of metadata service
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-09 08:11:26.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/fragments/make-cert.sh', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/fragments/write-heat-params-master.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/fragments/write-heat-params.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/make-cert.yaml'], 'message': 'Re: Remove dependency of metadata service

This changes were merged into upstream once[1], but lost now.
So I added this changes again.
And this fixes issues which occurs if "KUBE_API_PUBLIC_ADDRESS"
or "KUBE_API_PRIVATE_ADDRESS" are blank.

commit_message:

This changes were merged into upstream once[1], but lost now.
So I added this changes again.
And this fixes issues which occurs if "KUBE_API_PUBLIC_ADDRESS"
or "KUBE_API_PRIVATE_ADDRESS" are blank.

[1]: Idb30971e205e8fd94a478ef7d0bc6a30f5cab534

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 14:43:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/placement/util.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/placement/test_util.py'], 'message': "Fix handling of status in placement API json_error_formatter

The API-WG standard for error responses[1] says that the value of the
'status' key should be an int. webob error formatters receive the
status as a string (for example '400 Bad Request'). This change
fixes that and adds unit test coverage for the json_error_formatter
method.

This was a problem that was highlighted during review of the basic
framing of the placement API but was not resolved before that code
merged.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html

Change-Id: I243eeaf62f83417b77bc6fa4a7d6f898b1382ac1
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
"}]
commit_message:
Fix handling of status in placement API json_error_formatter

The API-WG standard for error responses[1] says that the value of the
'status' key should be an int. webob error formatters receive the
status as a string (for example '400 Bad Request'). This change
fixes that and adds unit test coverage for the json_error_formatter
method.

This was a problem that was highlighted during review of the basic
framing of the placement API but was not resolved before that code
merged.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html

Change-Id: I243eeaf62f83417b77bc6fa4a7d6f898b1382ac1
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

commit_message:
Add project group to role

This patch adds a var used by the repo_build process to determine
which host group to check for members of before building the pip
packages required by this role. This provides the ability to
optimise the repo build process to only building the packages
that are required for an environment.

Depends-On: Idda16b4f382eee57c7469af898859d6d81d4eb30
Change-Id: Iedb4c0c91daa291f881a9fc00c5b8c40bb312ce3

commit_message:
Modified Instance Form Submit behavior.

Add post function to Instance attach/detach interface form.
If an appropriate option is not chosen the form resets, allowing
for the user to go back into the form and correctly choose an option.

Change-Id: I7a52a4a78215b97e8ef0102c9def6c190351b2d5
Partially Closes-Bug: #1576869
(cherry picked from commit ca992259949a4747c541547d2e9adc167926796a)

commit_message:
Add filters for GET /api/transactions/

Add ability to filter transactions by transaction type
and status.

Examples:
 GET /api/transactions/?statuses=error
 GET /api/transactions/?cluster_id=2&transaction_types=provision,reset_environments

Closes-Bug: #1593751

Change-Id: If4443045992bfc3816ae219e7607f6897767ba5b

subject: Fix dependencies for cryptography pip install
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-11 13:58:01.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install_binary.yml', 'vars/redhat.yml', 'vars/debian.yml'], 'message': 'Fix dependencies for cryptography pip install

As a result of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/351482 the cryptography
pip package is installed as a requirement. This fails without the
apt/yum depencies on the libssl-dev/openssl-devel and
libffi-dev/libffi-devel packages.

This causes failures to other xenial gates. Adding these apt/yum package
installs resolves this.

Change-Id: Ic55f19978a8251ed0828a300df4a7b832ec4f186
'}]
commit_message:
Fix dependencies for cryptography pip install

As a result of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/351482 the cryptography
pip package is installed as a requirement. This fails without the
apt/yum depencies on the libssl-dev/openssl-devel and
libffi-dev/libffi-devel packages.

This causes failures to other xenial gates. Adding these apt/yum package
installs resolves this.

Change-Id: Ic55f19978a8251ed0828a300df4a7b832ec4f186

commit_message:
Mark this role supporting Ubuntu Xenial.

This role does not have any specific dependency on systemd,
upstart, init, etc. So there is no reason it can't be marked as
supporting Ubuntu Xenial.

Implements: blueprint support-ubuntu-1604

commit_message:
Emulate deployment history in FakeDeploymentThread

For development purposes, as well as UI team needs, Nailgun's deployment
fake thread should emulate Astute behaviour in terms of deployment
history feature. This allows us to easily test the feature on UI without
actual deployment, keep (weak) consistency with Astute and have
a determinted state in database (history records are 'ready') for tests
where fake threads is used.

Blueprint: ui-deployment-history
Closes-Bug: #1593757

Change-Id: I89351dfe293de0469c840db02cf8bba41f8e63af

commit_message:
Handle redirects for keystone

If keystone sends a redirect and we have TLS enabled, we need to

commit_message:
Allow provisioning and deployment of nodes in fuel2

This patch allows to start provisioning or deployment tasks
for specified nodes within an environment using the following
commands:

 - fuel2 environment nodes deploy
 - fuel2 environment nodes provision

DocImpact

commit_message:
Add amulet/bundle tests to charm-barbican-softhsm

This adds keystone v2 and v3 tests to the charm.
However, because of bug#1611393 the tests can't execute test 400 which
would check the API to barbican.  Thus, it is disabled and the tests
only check that the relation is set up properly.

commit_message:
cinder create without volume-type error

The cinder create command was failing if the default_volume_type
is provided in cinder.conf. This happened because of a bug introduced
in earlier change. This patch corrects the same

Change-Id: I4ac6841017c2126f20e185399e00761075d9d6ab
Closes-bug: #1610073

commit_message:
Fix Broken Link in Contributing > Blueprints Doc

The template link points to
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat-specs/tree/specs/template.rst
which shows a "Path not found" error. This patch instead points it to
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat-specs/tree/specs/templates
and explains that you should pick the template for the latest release.

Change-Id: Ibe202f351eafacdfe9112407f8611b01d5a96ada
Closes-Bug: #1612238

commit_message:
Made collection times configurable

The collector now checks the yaml configuration file for a variable
called collect_period.
If collect_period is specified, the collector will skip calling the
plugin and collecting metrics for the plugin until the specified
number of seconds has passed.

Change-Id: I423b1f14d4b0580e625e5f57c729c4a6c9923a93

subject: Last-Modified header support on HEAD/GET container
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14867, 'name': 'Jaivish Kothari(janonymous)', 'email': 'janonymous.codevulture@gmail.com', 'username': 'Janonymous'}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-06-07 11:02:39.000000000', 'files': ['swift/container/server.py', 'test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/container/test_server.py', 'test/functional/swift_test_client.py'], 'message': 'Last-Modified header support on HEAD/GET container

This patch enables to show a x-put-timestamp as
a last-modified header in container-server.

Note that the last-modified header will be changed only when a
request for container (PUT container or POST container) comes into
Swift. i.e. some requests for objects (e.g. PUT object, POST object)
will never affect the last-modified value but only when using
python-swiftclient like as "swift upload", the last-modified will
be close to the upload time because python-swiftclient will make
a PUT container request for "swift upload" each time.

Change-Id: I9971bf90d24eee8921f67c02b7e2c80fd8995623
'}]
commit_message:
Last-Modified header support on HEAD/GET container

This patch enables to show a x-put-timestamp as
a last-modified header in container-server.

Note that the last-modified header will be changed only when a
request for container (PUT container or POST container) comes into
Swift. i.e. some requests for objects (e.g. PUT object, POST object)
will never affect the last-modified value but only when using
python-swiftclient like as "swift upload", the last-modified will
be close to the upload time because python-swiftclient will make
a PUT container request for "swift upload" each time.

Change-Id: I9971bf90d24eee8921f67c02b7e2c80fd8995623

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-11 10:41:02.000000000', 'files': ['rally/cli/commands/verify.py', 'etc/rally.bash_completion'], 'message': "[Verify] Deprecating 'tests-file' and 'xfails-file' args

This patch deprecates the following args for `rally verify start` cmd:

     Old           New
 tests-file  -> load-list
 xfails-file -> xfail-list

So now we have consistent args that allow us to manage the workflow for
a certain list of tests:

 1. Arg 'load-list' - Run tests listed in the named file
 2. Arg 'skip-list' - Skip run of tests listed in the named file
 3. Arg 'xfail-list' - Consider tests listed in the named file as
                       expected failures

Change-Id: Ida1252172c7edf7e7dd5350123a52c085867ba0f
"}]
commit_message:
[Verify] Deprecating 'tests-file' and 'xfails-file' args

This patch deprecates the following args for `rally verify start` cmd:

     Old           New
 tests-file  -> load-list
 xfails-file -> xfail-list

So now we have consistent args that allow us to manage the workflow for
a certain list of tests:

 1. Arg 'load-list' - Run tests listed in the named file
 2. Arg 'skip-list' - Skip run of tests listed in the named file
 3. Arg 'xfail-list' - Consider tests listed in the named file as
                       expected failures

Change-Id: Ida1252172c7edf7e7dd5350123a52c085867ba0f

Change-Id: I10d73991d566d0ad0f6a91cf11cf835a8299e387

commit_message:
Disable stderr logging

OSLO logging currently defaults the 'use_stderr' option to True
which results duplicate logs in service daemon logs for both
upstart and systemd. To correct this issue the use_stderr
option has been set to false.

Change-Id: I10d73991d566d0ad0f6a91cf11cf835a8299e387
Closes-Bug: 1588051
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 532025c21dd543745123c5b1120e5a41b2af2988)

commit_message:
Add support for value with :array_matching support

Some *config type have ```:array_matching => all``` setup in their
type.  Not sure why, but this add support for such type.

Currently I identified:

 - neutron_lbaas_service_config
 - nova_config
 - neutron_vpnaas_service_config
 - neutron_config
 - ceilometer_config
 - barbican_config

Change-Id: I674c480c455dafe681e2a1b8f2c55eef20fb7a3a

commit_message:
Rename baymodel to cluster_template

Magnum is renaming baymodel to cluster_template. Rather than releasing a
shade version with baymodel and then later switching, go ahead and
rename to cluster_template now. However, since the term isn't in wide
use yet, provide aliases.

Change-Id: Ieb1f067680f2312eacf75eed0d42edbd90c54beb

Depends-On: I0a44bf05b24a66a76c9dac3f262991c894677ceb

commit_message:
fix the tosca-parser job

There is a limit of 127 characters for the python interpreter used in
our testing CI. The depends-on patch renames the job to a shorter name.
This patch updates the tox virtual env definition. Once the depends-on
is merged, this change should fix the job.

Depends-On: I0a44bf05b24a66a76c9dac3f262991c894677ceb

Change-Id: I117b57702e06716d0ba3af1ef974fcff8c15d460

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-05 15:26:30.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/services/network/base.py'], 'message': "Don't load non json body

Some neutron POST APIs don't return response body, for instance,
dhcp-agent-network-add and l3-agent-router-add. However,
BaseNetworkClient passes all response body to json.loads.
This patch add a check for response body.

Change-Id: I7a4c565f9e067e1771bf6ec85c9c0486937a2cef
Related-Bug: #1555921
"}]
commit_message:
Don't load non json body

Some neutron POST APIs don't return response body, for instance,
dhcp-agent-network-add and l3-agent-router-add. However,
BaseNetworkClient passes all response body to json.loads.
This patch add a check for response body.

Change-Id: I7a4c565f9e067e1771bf6ec85c9c0486937a2cef
Related-Bug: #1555921

commit_message:
Skipping test_volume_backed_live_migration for live_migration job

For non-shared storage live-migration job is unstable due to
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1524898. This patch temporary
exclude this test from tests to be run.

Related-Bug: #1524898

Change-Id: I87559b8e90855837ad7b5f291bd9a8fc646421d3

commit_message:
Fix to_json_schema() call

The to_json_schema() method now has the 'required_fields' incorrectly
placed outside of the 'data_key' dict. This patch moves it inside that
dict.

Closes-Bug: #1608870

This patch adds a missing namevar method for some providers which was
preventing the ini_setting's purge support from cleaning up unmanaged

Change-Id: Ia11335901f422cb6470ede78234e8a59115e675d

commit_message:
Fix provider files for purge support

This patch adds a missing namevar method for some providers which was
preventing the ini_setting's purge support from cleaning up unmanaged
entries from config files.

Closes-Bug: #1612009

Change-Id: Ia11335901f422cb6470ede78234e8a59115e675d

which was preventing ini_setting's purge support from cleaning up

commit_message:
Fix nova_config provider for purge support

This patch adds a missing namevar method to the nova_config provider
which was preventing ini_setting's purge support from cleaning up
unmanaged entries from config files.

Change-Id: Ibc6e891b7d5f7bb8b131311f1e15afcd4a99378d
Closes-Bug: #1612009

commit_message:
Support search through filter control options

User can input in a search value to find a specific filter option.

'label' property of a filter options renamed to 'title'
to be consistent with Filter and Sorter objects that
have 'title' property and can be used as the control options.

Change-Id: Ic11d6c89173f2f309f933802a618933f4e580e4d

commit_message:
Split out the requirements repo into its own team

This patch splits out the requirements repo from the Release
Management team into its own team for the purpose of generating
an electoral roll for the requirements ptl election.

This patch does not need to be merged to serve its purpose. Once
the ptl has been selected, this patch can be abandoned and another
patch can take its place.

Change-Id: I48e3872e0e6b13f95dba7deb01cbabd907f8a045

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-13 15:41:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_firewall.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_securitygroups_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_iptables_firewall.py'], 'message': 'Update in-memory firewall for only requested ports

When applying port filters for the requested ports,
current implementation
1) removes in-memory firewall rules for all "existing" ports i.e
   for all ports on that agent
2) adds (or removes) requested ports to(from) "existing" ports
3) then creates in-memory firewall rules for these "existing" ports

But when the agent has large number of ports, this process will take
longer time. Instead of removing and then adding firewall rules for
all the ports, we directly update in-memory firewall rules with the
firewall rules of requested ports. This will save agents time spent
on processing in-memory firewall rules.

Partial-Bug: #1499177
Change-Id: Ied255d16782ae9c0c6a3a4767aa837ef4616843e
'}]
commit_message:
Update in-memory firewall for only requested ports

When applying port filters for the requested ports,
current implementation
1) removes in-memory firewall rules for all "existing" ports i.e
   for all ports on that agent
2) adds (or removes) requested ports to(from) "existing" ports
3) then creates in-memory firewall rules for these "existing" ports

But when the agent has large number of ports, this process will take
longer time. Instead of removing and then adding firewall rules for
all the ports, we directly update in-memory firewall rules with the
firewall rules of requested ports. This will save agents time spent
on processing in-memory firewall rules.

Partial-Bug: #1499177
Change-Id: Ied255d16782ae9c0c6a3a4767aa837ef4616843e

subject: Nova: serial console (live migration test)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-04 13:46:20.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_live_migration.py'], 'message': 'Nova: serial console (live migration test)

Nova offers a "serial console" as an alternative to graphical consoles
like VNC/SPICE/RDP. This is useful for platforms which don't have
graphical consoles, for example the "IBM system z" platform.

This change introduces a test which checks the behavior when an
instance with a serial console gets live-migrated. The Nova live-
migration code needs to update the ports to bind on the host. If
Nova does that correctly, the connection to the serial console
is still possible after a live-migration.

Related-Bug: 1489853
Depends-On: I7af395a867e0657c26fa064d2b0134345cd96814
Change-Id: I26f7732d8e283602674036ff402b333e07d1e9b5
'}]
commit_message:
Nova: serial console (live migration test)

Nova offers a "serial console" as an alternative to graphical consoles
like VNC/SPICE/RDP. This is useful for platforms which don't have
graphical consoles, for example the "IBM system z" platform.

This change introduces a test which checks the behavior when an
instance with a serial console gets live-migrated. The Nova live-
migration code needs to update the ports to bind on the host. If
Nova does that correctly, the connection to the serial console
is still possible after a live-migration.

Related-Bug: 1489853
Depends-On: I7af395a867e0657c26fa064d2b0134345cd96814
Change-Id: I26f7732d8e283602674036ff402b333e07d1e9b5

subject: Nova: serial console (port release test)
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-04 13:46:20.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_server_serial_console.py'], 'message': 'Nova: serial console (port release test)

Nova offers a "serial console" as an alternative to graphical consoles
like VNC/SPICE/RDP. This is useful for platforms which don't have
graphical consoles, for example the "IBM system z" platform.

This change introduces a test which checks if the ports associated
to an instance get released when the instance gets deleted. If they
won't get released properly, a port exhaustion can be the result.

Related-Bug: 1489853
Change-Id: Ifb500f65ca37a93284753b721f244835a33b36c6
'}]
commit_message:
Nova: serial console (port release test)

Nova offers a "serial console" as an alternative to graphical consoles
like VNC/SPICE/RDP. This is useful for platforms which don't have
graphical consoles, for example the "IBM system z" platform.

This change introduces a test which checks if the ports associated
to an instance get released when the instance gets deleted. If they
won't get released properly, a port exhaustion can be the result.

Related-Bug: 1489853
Change-Id: Ifb500f65ca37a93284753b721f244835a33b36c6

commit_message:
Nova: get serial console (interaction test)

Nova offers a "serial console" as an alternative to graphical consoles
like VNC/SPICE/RDP. This is useful for platforms which don't have
graphical consoles, for example the "IBM system z" platform.

This change introduces a test which checks if an interaction to the
serial console of an instance is possible.

Change-Id: I9063cbc3af715ec977f1a9f8a9deaf02570b1df5

Change-Id: I10d73991d566d0ad0f6a91cf11cf835a8299e387

commit_message:
Disable stderr logging

OSLO logging currently defaults the 'use_stderr' option to True
which results duplicate logs in service daemon logs for both
upstart and systemd. To correct this issue the use_stderr
option has been set to false.

Change-Id: I10d73991d566d0ad0f6a91cf11cf835a8299e387
Closes-Bug: 1588051
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Make mistral work with amqp and zmq backends

Since adding alternative rpc layer all services was throwing
exception on start if rpc_backend was different from 'rabbit'.
This patch change this behaviour and make mistral work again
with zmq and amqp.

Change-Id: I704e218ea800193504e3be9974627056db4a88b4

commit_message:
[WIP] Power off the machine before set_boot_devic

Some technologies requires that the server is powered off to switch the primary
boot device. This patch moves the call to set_boot_device on
AgentVendorInterface to the reboot_and_finish_deploy, just before it powers back
on.

Change-Id: I954def250daba7e99829e09e6b3e8a1febcca05c
Closes-Bug: #1503855

commit_message:
Disable all hiera override yamls for globals

We need to ensure that globals uses only astute.yaml to generate its
helper variables. Othewise, we will have an issue on the second
deployment if we modify astute.yaml and re-run the deployment

Relates to I91ab492b44c137c476722f65de3dd99b2dce988a

Change-Id: Ieef42f063911ed05ce05f1411bbaa1d4867aa455
Related-Bug: #1590375
Closes-bug: #1598163

There is no strict boolean checking for the parameter
"multiattach" of API /volumes, so that
any invalid boolean value can be specified.
This patch adds a strict checking for it to prevent

Change-Id: I2a5dc45a3b238a2d875d7fbf7159eb91d1f111bf
Partial-Bug: #1594261

commit_message:
Add strict Boolean checking for volume create

There is no strict boolean checking for the parameter
"multiattach" of API /volumes, so that
any invalid boolean value can be specified.
This patch adds a strict checking for it to prevent
invalid value, and adds tests for this change as well.

Change-Id: I2a5dc45a3b238a2d875d7fbf7159eb91d1f111bf
Partial-Bug: #1594261

We have tox -e gendriverlist that outputs an RST-ish report of all drivers
in the tree. This output can be used in the docs build to automatically
publish the list of drivers to make it easier to find officially supported
drivers.

This effectively removes the existing drivers.html that was generated prior
that did not actually contain any useful information.

Change-Id: I8de78723af76aabcc976733ac4b248db0b8ca16f
'}]
commit_message:
Add driver list to doc build

We have tox -e gendriverlist that outputs an RST-ish report of all drivers
in the tree. This output can be used in the docs build to automatically
publish the list of drivers to make it easier to find officially supported
drivers.

This effectively removes the existing drivers.html that was generated prior
that did not actually contain any useful information.

Change-Id: I8de78723af76aabcc976733ac4b248db0b8ca16f

commit_message:
Add -n to iptables calls

This change updates the calls that we use in the ocf scripts to
determine if the rules are present to include the -n flag to prevent
unnecessary dns lookups which can lead to deployment failures if dns is
unavailable.

Change-Id: I17d04fbad6def1217429fc3c92bed997fd510eb8
Closes-Bug: #1605540

commit_message:
Break noop queue

With a recent change check-tripleo-jobs template
now has both check and gate jobs. Remove noop-jobs template from
tripleo-image-elements.

Noticed while looking at zuul and having lots of jobs in the gate with
"noop" jobs in it.

Change-Id: I177f69e5d64426c6278a96440982e2fb354f4fc6

commit_message:
Strengthen the permission for the generated ssh key

As the ssh server requires private keys to have strict permissions, provides
them so that they are immediately usable.

Also change the opening mode to a more appropriate one.

Change-Id: I330c0aadf40b364c46801aa916493c367de25a8b

subject: Display full reason for backend not available
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-08 18:26:16.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/test_base.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/provision.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_provision.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_fixtures.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Display full reason for backend not available

This adds to the provisioning system the ability
to preserve and re-display the full reason for a
particular DB backend not available, and propagates
this all the way through the skip() emitted
by the OpportunisticTestCase and DbFixture.

As part of the change, the database type requested
is added to the messages themselves, which
also appears in the messages emitted by the
consuming is_backend_avail() function, which
has tests that check for these explicit messages.
New tests specific to the Backend object are
added which are not dependent on is_backend_avail();
as this function is deprecated, we will be
able to remove its tests at the same time
as the function itself with no loss in coverage.

Change-Id: I7c00e0770b02aa751e184edfecdec4306de6340c
'}]
commit_message:
Display full reason for backend not available

This adds to the provisioning system the ability
to preserve and re-display the full reason for a
particular DB backend not available, and propagates
this all the way through the skip() emitted
by the OpportunisticTestCase and DbFixture.

As part of the change, the database type requested
is added to the messages themselves, which
also appears in the messages emitted by the
consuming is_backend_avail() function, which
has tests that check for these explicit messages.
New tests specific to the Backend object are
added which are not dependent on is_backend_avail();
as this function is deprecated, we will be
able to remove its tests at the same time
as the function itself with no loss in coverage.

Change-Id: I7c00e0770b02aa751e184edfecdec4306de6340c

* In case if task execution was not actually created (e.g. if 'join'
  was already created by a different transaction) we should not
  schedule any post completion checks.

Change-Id: I023d47870cbf137ea0de88d29f7df86591c6c19f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix task post completion scheduling

* In case if task execution was not actually created (e.g. if 'join'
  was already created by a different transaction) we should not
  schedule any post completion checks.

Change-Id: I023d47870cbf137ea0de88d29f7df86591c6c19f

subject: Define cinder_default_volume_type for gating.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-10 21:00:47.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-vars.yml'], 'message': 'Define cinder_default_volume_type for gating.

According to upstream bug[0] a volume_type must be specified when
creating a volume.  Since tempest does not provide a volume_type this
patch defines default_volume_type and sets it to lvm.

[0]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1610073

Change-Id: I801cc3d3b846e0be3b777a57753e01406d3273d2
Closes-Bug: #1611937
'}]
commit_message:
Define cinder_default_volume_type for gating.

According to upstream bug[0] a volume_type must be specified when
creating a volume.  Since tempest does not provide a volume_type this
patch defines default_volume_type and sets it to lvm.

[0]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1610073

Change-Id: I801cc3d3b846e0be3b777a57753e01406d3273d2

commit_message:
Add new CLI commands for managing cluster facts

This patch introduces the following commands to the new fuel2
CLI:

  - fuel2 env deployment-facts delete
  - fuel2 env deployment-facts download
  - fuel2 env deployment-facts get-default
  - fuel2 env deployment-facts upload
  - fuel2 env provisioning-facts delete
  - fuel2 env provisioning-facts download
  - fuel2 env provisioning-facts get-default
  - fuel2 env provisioning-facts upload

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie8ed2b7df794cabbee5c1b6830769deba10e8b2e

subject: Fix comparison to control_virtual_ip
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-12 15:58:14.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/loadbalancer.pp'], 'message': "Fix comparison to control_virtual_ip

When managing the vip's, we were incorrectly comparing the vip to
$control_virtual_interface instead of $controller_virtual_ip when
determining if we needed to actually create the vip or not.

This caused the vips for internal api, storage, and storage mgmt to
always be created even if they were the same as the control vip. Afaict,
this didn't actually cause any problems, other than having extra vip's
created when they weren't needed. Still, this corrects the code to do
what it was intended to do.

Change-Id: I29aee95afcba25008b8b7bee37ba636eb2595cca
(cherry picked from commit 4c0a136a40655171a14ca4be304193863eac06bd)
Closes-Bug: #1602319
"}]
commit_message:
Fix comparison to control_virtual_ip

When managing the vip's, we were incorrectly comparing the vip to
$control_virtual_interface instead of $controller_virtual_ip when
determining if we needed to actually create the vip or not.

This caused the vips for internal api, storage, and storage mgmt to
always be created even if they were the same as the control vip. Afaict,
this didn't actually cause any problems, other than having extra vip's
created when they weren't needed. Still, this corrects the code to do
what it was intended to do.

Change-Id: I29aee95afcba25008b8b7bee37ba636eb2595cca
(cherry picked from commit 4c0a136a40655171a14ca4be304193863eac06bd)
Closes-Bug: #1602319

commit_message:
Keystone_user fails with v2 openrc.

When /root/openrc is present and has a v2 auth_url, then keystone_user
resource will fail to check the password.

Change-Id: I4e7eb383800348ac55f11c68f45437c567507b79
Closes-Bug: #1522541
(cherry picked from commit a0fc779b26f12784aa506a1bd47e0b43c5da1827)

commit_message:
Fix idempotency of keystone_tenant description

If description is not defined for existing resource it won't try to set
it to empty string.

Closes-bug: #1593723
(cherry picked from commit ba622e4e47e12f08c3b803d8a8ec211c358f1d1a)

commit_message:
Change murano rabbit username and password

Currently murano rabbit uses same credentials that uses main cluster
rabbit. Although user for murano uses different rabbitmq instance,
better to use another credentials, that are different from main infra.

Change-Id: I42423f2c2b0333167244a4c17886325f4e629b12
Closes-bug: #1609355

subject: Fix French locale build
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-11 10:53:31.000000000', 'files': ['aodh/locale/fr/LC_MESSAGES/aodh.po'], 'message': "Fix French locale build

https://review.openstack.org/352007 created an issue with the French
locale, as it set an empty PO-Revision-Date: value. That made catalog
build fail with:

ValueError: time data u'' does not match format '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M'

Change-Id: I6f0c3622643a50701617ac031ac9cd3b7ed3649a"}]
commit_message:
Fix French locale build

https://review.openstack.org/352007 created an issue with the French
locale, as it set an empty PO-Revision-Date: value. That made catalog
build fail with:

ValueError: time data u'' does not match format '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M'

Change-Id: I6f0c3622643a50701617ac031ac9cd3b7ed3649a

subject: Add a 'meta' passthrough parameter for glance images
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-08-08 15:27:25.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_caching.py', 'releasenotes/notes/meta-passthrough-d695bff4f9366b65.yaml', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Add a 'meta' passthrough parameter for glance images

create_image tries to do data type conversion for you so that what you
mean is correct 90% of the time. However, inferring intent is hard on
people who do know what they want.

New parameter 'meta' is a vehicle for non-converted key/value pairs.

Change-Id: I99c1a104f6eb8fe72dd4ebab5b3aac8231068eb7
"}]
commit_message:
Add a 'meta' passthrough parameter for glance images

create_image tries to do data type conversion for you so that what you
mean is correct 90% of the time. However, inferring intent is hard on
people who do know what they want.

New parameter 'meta' is a vehicle for non-converted key/value pairs.

Change-Id: I99c1a104f6eb8fe72dd4ebab5b3aac8231068eb7

subject: Add ability to upload duplicate images
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-05 20:39:32.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/functional/test_image.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Add ability to upload duplicate images

In the basic case, avoiding re-uploading images is nice because
uploading images is a costly operation. However, there are also usecases
for uploading new images with the same name as an operator which are
quite valid. Support these by allowing for a flag that overrides the
duplicate checking logic.

Change-Id: I6a00753654d500d68750e46c5ec2423a36903552
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to upload duplicate images

In the basic case, avoiding re-uploading images is nice because
uploading images is a costly operation. However, there are also usecases
for uploading new images with the same name as an operator which are
quite valid. Support these by allowing for a flag that overrides the
duplicate checking logic.

Change-Id: I6a00753654d500d68750e46c5ec2423a36903552

1. Removed redundant method from drivers -
   get_update_method as it is accessible via
   configuration and there's no need for adding
   such a function.
2. Fixed zabbix get_all bug, zabbix alarms key is
   now comprised of the alarm's host name, raw text
   description and the trigger id.

Change-Id: I2f885a1f4e12f69db15a819b62359b3290054364
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant method + Zabbix fix

1. Removed redundant method from drivers -
   get_update_method as it is accessible via
   configuration and there's no need for adding
   such a function.
2. Fixed zabbix get_all bug, zabbix alarms key is
   now comprised of the alarm's host name, raw text
   description and the trigger id.

Change-Id: I2f885a1f4e12f69db15a819b62359b3290054364

   fuel2 node undiscover [-h] (-e ENV | -n NODE) [-f]

commit_message:
Add fuel2 commands to undiscover nodes

Release new fuel2 commands that allow to undiscover
(delete from database) nodes regardless of their
state (-f/--force flag), e.g.:

   fuel2 node undiscover [-h] (-e ENV | -n NODE) [-f]

DocImpact

Change-Id: I602d3b6f5f7803fce01d3440b3e41f787a4b99d5

commit_message:
Update virsh secret if rbd_keyring or libvirt_rbd_secret_uuid change

This change allows puppet to regenerate the virsh secret or update
its key if one of rbd_keyring or libvirt_rbd_secret_uuid change.

Closes-Bug: 1583998
Related-Bug: 1606918
Change-Id: I66d343c7c6a4ef0e7ceabe099af00a170f845b2f
Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a2794ea4079129d33ede5eef2934dd40cda4cd15)
