revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-09 14:43:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py'], 'message': "pep8: fixed F821 violation in a unit test

The _ symbol should have been imported explicitly. Actually, there is no
use case for translatable messages in unit tests, it's just a waste of
translator time to mark it as such. The patch removes the translation
marker for good.

Change-Id: I76bef710a1030dcb4eb35778ebf44ed600016f17
Closes-Bug: #1611400
"}]
commit_message:
pep8: fixed F821 violation in a unit test

The _ symbol should have been imported explicitly. Actually, there is no
use case for translatable messages in unit tests, it's just a waste of
translator time to mark it as such. The patch removes the translation
marker for good.

Change-Id: I76bef710a1030dcb4eb35778ebf44ed600016f17
Closes-Bug: #1611400

commit_message:
Reconfigure resolv.conf once cobbler is installed

Once cobbler is ready and working
we need to re-configure /etc/resolv.conf so it points to
cobbler.

Change-Id: I43cf1607dcfcd5e19daeb30512a0b18ee8d6a7be
Closes-Bug: #1606181

commit_message:
Add absent __init__.py to migrations/versions

Without the versions/__init__.py file versions was not identified as
a package and was not included in a distribution.

Change-Id: I67f152ebb9234df880c61d79d154b1aabc8828c6
Closes-Bug: #1611793

subject: Add Port type to allow configuration of a list of tcp/ip ports
revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2016-08-11 09:06:12.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_cfg.py', 'oslo_config/tests/test_types.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-port_type-8704295c6a56265d.yaml', 'oslo_config/types.py'], 'message': 'Add Port type to allow configuration of a list of tcp/ip ports

There was already a PortOpt, but this is not composable with ListOpt.
The new type inherits from Integer and therefore supports min/max
value and choices. For example, openstack/vmware-nsx wants to use this
to configure a default list of ports for a firewall rule.

Change-Id: I83bbec6add8ce2951e94e69ec14bb6d8137d4f0c
'}]
commit_message:
Add Port type to allow configuration of a list of tcp/ip ports

There was already a PortOpt, but this is not composable with ListOpt.
The new type inherits from Integer and therefore supports min/max
value and choices. For example, openstack/vmware-nsx wants to use this
to configure a default list of ports for a firewall rule.

Change-Id: I83bbec6add8ce2951e94e69ec14bb6d8137d4f0c

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-05 08:30:00.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_actions.py', 'cinder/image/image_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/vhd-disk-format-upload-to-image-5851f9d35f4ee447.yaml'], 'message': "Fix volume upload-to-image for vhd disk-format

It was previously assumed that glance did not support qed
disk-format.
qemu-img still uses the legacy 'vpc' format name as a
parameter. When executing 'qemu-img convert', vhd was
being passed as a parameter which is invalid.

This fix adds 'vhd' to the valid disk formats and passes
'vpc' to 'qemu-img convert', which is correct use of the
command. Also added 'vhdx' to the valid disk formats.

Change-Id: I24e6b78505a2c77b309c79ef11466c08bad1c50a
Closes-Bug: #1585612
"}]
commit_message:
Fix volume upload-to-image for vhd disk-format

It was previously assumed that glance did not support qed
disk-format.
qemu-img still uses the legacy 'vpc' format name as a
parameter. When executing 'qemu-img convert', vhd was
being passed as a parameter which is invalid.

This fix adds 'vhd' to the valid disk formats and passes
'vpc' to 'qemu-img convert', which is correct use of the
command. Also added 'vhdx' to the valid disk formats.

Change-Id: I24e6b78505a2c77b309c79ef11466c08bad1c50a
Closes-Bug: #1585612

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-11 06:07:00.000000000', 'files': ['network/endpoints/endpoint_map.yaml', 'puppet/services/manila-api.yaml', 'network/endpoints/endpoint_data.yaml'], 'message': 'Add hieradata for Manila v1 and v2 endpoints

manila::keystone::auth assumes that two endpoints will be created;
one for each version of Manila. This is not consistent with what we
provide to the manifest. So we then add the needed endpoint to the
EndpointMap.

v2 is left as the default (not needing to specify a version when
getting the value from the endpoint map), and v1 was added as an
extra suffix.

Change-Id: Ie8754fbb21f50c2613a2c05a52d771f4d1aeb4bb
'}]
commit_message:
Add hieradata for Manila v1 and v2 endpoints

manila::keystone::auth assumes that two endpoints will be created;
one for each version of Manila. This is not consistent with what we
provide to the manifest. So we then add the needed endpoint to the
EndpointMap.

v2 is left as the default (not needing to specify a version when
getting the value from the endpoint map), and v1 was added as an
extra suffix.

Change-Id: Ie8754fbb21f50c2613a2c05a52d771f4d1aeb4bb

Change-Id: I01032c32a94ded771acabddc196f79aee55c7857

commit_message:
[Reports] Expand menu if there is only one menu group

HTML report menu groups scenarios by their first part
of name (before `.').

There is no reason to have menu collapsed if there is
only one menu group (for example, if there are only
Dummy scenarios).

Change-Id: I01032c32a94ded771acabddc196f79aee55c7857

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-09 17:26:39.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/tests/test_strutils.py', 'oslo_utils/strutils.py'], 'message': "Add utils for validating and splitting quotes

Now Murano and Glance have similiar implementations of validating

The style of this functionality should be common as they follow

isn't revoked.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/common/utils.py#L601-L644
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/murano/blob/master/murano/common/utils.py#L250-L301

Change-Id: I15236d28b2136153db093590fb4dae65a87eb3e3
Co-Authored-By: Alexis Lee <lxsli@hpe.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add utils for validating and splitting quotes

Now Murano and Glance have similiar implementations of validating
and splitting quotes for using operator 'in' in their API [1],[2].

The style of this functionality should be common as they follow
appropriate api-wg style [3]. So it would be great to have them
implemented in one place and reuse in different projects.

TBD: add appropriate commits to Murano and Glance if this patch
isn't revoked.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/common/utils.py#L601-L644
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/murano/blob/master/murano/common/utils.py#L250-L301
[3]: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/pagination_filter_sort.html#filtering

Change-Id: I15236d28b2136153db093590fb4dae65a87eb3e3
Co-Authored-By: Alexis Lee <lxsli@hpe.com>

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 23:40:51.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Idb12c1383d8cbf8b22eed7bd9877d6e4fbc8bcc8
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Idb12c1383d8cbf8b22eed7bd9877d6e4fbc8bcc8

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4491, 'name': 'Lianhao Lu', 'email': 'lianhao.lu@intel.com', 'username': 'lianhao-lu'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 9562, 'name': 'Ildiko Vancsa', 'email': 'ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com', 'username': 'ildikov'}, {'_account_id': 15843, 'name': 'Intel Hardware-Meters CI', 'email': 'ipmi-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'ipmici'}, {'_account_id': 22739, 'name': 'Zhuangqing Xiao', 'email': 'zhuangqing.xiao@easystack.cn', 'username': 'xiaozhuangqing'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-10 21:05:04.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/unit/hardware/inspector/test_snmp.py', 'ceilometer/hardware/inspector/snmp.py'], 'message': "ValueError exception when SNMP returns NoSuchObject

When an SNMP server doesn't implement a particular variable, pysnmp gives
us back a NoSuchObject object.  We can check for that when we fail to
convert the value to the type we're expecting it to be and safely return
None instead.

Change-Id: Ideb7ab68a0d3c6f0d133fafe020309c19cbdd7c7
Closes-Bug: #1611515
"}]
commit_message:
ValueError exception when SNMP returns NoSuchObject

When an SNMP server doesn't implement a particular variable, pysnmp gives
us back a NoSuchObject object.  We can check for that when we fail to
convert the value to the type we're expecting it to be and safely return
None instead.

Change-Id: Ideb7ab68a0d3c6f0d133fafe020309c19cbdd7c7
Closes-Bug: #1611515

commit_message:
Add fuel2 commands for node interfaces and disks

This patch adds commands that allow to download and upload
configuration of interfaces and disks for a node:

 - fuel2 node interfaces download
 - fuel2 node interfaces upload
 - fuel2 node interfaces get-default
 - fuel2 node disk upload
 - fuel2 node disk download
 - fuel2 node disk get-default

DocImpact
Change-Id: I5c888b9d0d8069def40dd3a0d997cf3b4e9d54ff

commit_message:
Add new CLI commands for managing cluster networks and settings

This patch introduces the following commands to the new fuel2
CLI:

  - fuel2 env network download
  - fuel2 env network upload
  - fuel2 env network verify
  - fuel2 env settings download
  - fuel2 env settings upload

DocImpact
Change-Id: Iab92de0f0dbc453d5ea36f83d10252911e37d163

Many assertEqual sentences don't follow assertEqual(expected, actual),
These misplaces have 2 impacts:
1, giving confusing messages when some tests failed.
2, mislead other developers, new test modules may follow these wrong pattern.

This patch fix all of them.

Change-Id: Ia5155114c60f5e27cb00b8aba6de5cf32e046dd7
Closes-Bug: #1604213
"}]
commit_message:
Fix parameters of assertEqual are misplaced

Many assertEqual sentences don't follow assertEqual(expected, actual),
These misplaces have 2 impacts:
1, giving confusing messages when some tests failed.
2, mislead other developers, new test modules may follow these wrong pattern.

This patch fix all of them.

Change-Id: Ia5155114c60f5e27cb00b8aba6de5cf32e046dd7
Closes-Bug: #1604213

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 20:05:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/vnc.py'], 'message': 'vnc host options need to support hostnames

When updating the config options the VNC options were switched from
StrOpt to IPOpt. However these are hostnames, they even say so in the
option name, so IPOpt is too restrictive, and could break folks in
upgrade if they set these to hostnames.

Change-Id: Ib2062407dcf9cba8676b0f38aa0c63df25cc7b38
Closes-Bug: #1611940
'}]
commit_message:
vnc host options need to support hostnames

When updating the config options the VNC options were switched from
StrOpt to IPOpt. However these are hostnames, they even say so in the
option name, so IPOpt is too restrictive, and could break folks in
upgrade if they set these to hostnames.

Change-Id: Ib2062407dcf9cba8676b0f38aa0c63df25cc7b38
Closes-Bug: #1611940

commit_message:
[WIP] Upgrade of master node tests rework

Previous approach was not scale-able and flexible because we are
using different code/api in different fuel-qa branches.
Now it's time to unify all tests for allowing to commit fixes easier.

commit_message:
A follow-up on 'Splitting current/deprecated integ. test'

A previous patch for Horizon infra scipts missed passing {testtype}
into post_test_hook, which is required to properly copy various
testing artifacts into the right directory (which now depends on
{testtype}).

Change-Id: I20232ef16ae60a7151e267b506af471ebfed2f7f
Partially-Implements: blueprint test-deprecated-features

subject: Add jobs for Manila glusterfs, glusterfs-native drivers with Heketi layout
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-10 12:38:32.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add jobs for Manila glusterfs, glusterfs-native drivers with Heketi layout

"Heketi layout" is a novel setup method for the Manila gluster* drivers
which require dedicated Jenkins jobs.

Set the job as experimental and non-voting for the Manila project
as the Heketi layout is still WIP.

Set the job as non-voting for the devstack-plugin-glusterfs project until
the job is proven to be stable.

Change-Id: Ic3a358f5f8a0f5ea87989c87d8e246c426b937c2
'}]
commit_message:
Add jobs for Manila glusterfs, glusterfs-native drivers with Heketi layout

"Heketi layout" is a novel setup method for the Manila gluster* drivers
which require dedicated Jenkins jobs.

Set the job as experimental and non-voting for the Manila project
as the Heketi layout is still WIP.

Set the job as non-voting for the devstack-plugin-glusterfs project until
the job is proven to be stable.

Change-Id: Ic3a358f5f8a0f5ea87989c87d8e246c426b937c2

subject: templatize Manila GlusterFS jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-10 12:38:32.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/manila.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'templatize Manila GlusterFS jobs

These jobs are almost identical, so we can cut back
on redundancy by merging them into a template.

Also adding new instances of this template to
have experimental jobs on Xenial. (Once they
prove to be stable, we cut back on variety
and move completely to Xenial.)

Change-Id: I366493c75e07c2414c97781a01769dc052c4bb7e
'}]
commit_message:
templatize Manila GlusterFS jobs

These jobs are almost identical, so we can cut back
on redundancy by merging them into a template.

Also adding new instances of this template to
have experimental jobs on Xenial. (Once they
prove to be stable, we cut back on variety
and move completely to Xenial.)

Change-Id: I366493c75e07c2414c97781a01769dc052c4bb7e

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-10 06:57:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'nova/policies/servers.py'], 'message': "Fix server operations' policies to admin only

Before the following policies were set to admin only operations
by default.

* detail:get_all_tenants
* index:get_all_tenants
* create:forced_host

But currently they are not limited to admin users by default.
They were changed unintentionally in
I71b3d1233255125cb280a000b990329f5b03fdfd.
So set them admin only again.
And a unit test for policy is fixed.

Change-Id: I1c0a4f1ff19d68152953dd6b265a7fb2e0f6271a
Closes-Bug: #1609625
Closes-Bug: #1609691
Closes-Bug: #1611628
"}]
commit_message:
Fix server operations' policies to admin only

Before the following policies were set to admin only operations
by default.

* detail:get_all_tenants
* index:get_all_tenants
* create:forced_host

But currently they are not limited to admin users by default.
They were changed unintentionally in
I71b3d1233255125cb280a000b990329f5b03fdfd.
So set them admin only again.
And a unit test for policy is fixed.

Change-Id: I1c0a4f1ff19d68152953dd6b265a7fb2e0f6271a
Closes-Bug: #1609625
Closes-Bug: #1609691
Closes-Bug: #1611628

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-10 19:30:11.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Move to Ubuntu-trusty for Libvirt/LXC test

In a recent patch [1], gate config was changed to

Change-Id: Id28ee31e7e2d23849fc34a2186b93ac0780e27bb
Related-Bug: #1558268
Related-Bug: #1611042
'}]
commit_message:
Move to Ubuntu-trusty for Libvirt/LXC test

In a recent patch [1], gate config was changed to
use F23 image. However, that change did not turn out
fruitful as mentioned in comments on [2].
In recent local testing with Ubuntu trusty image from RAX DFW,
the gate tests have been passing.
So changing gate config to use the Ubuntu image to
see how it fairs upstream.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/293585/5
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-gate/+bug/1558268

Change-Id: Id28ee31e7e2d23849fc34a2186b93ac0780e27bb
Related-Bug: #1558268
Related-Bug: #1611042

commit_message:
Make Tripleo nonha-multinode and undercloud jobs voting

Move the gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-nonha-multinode-nv and
gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-nv jobs to become voting by dropping
their -nv suffix. Since the jobs are made voting, they are added to the
gate queue as well.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-11 07:45:29.000000000', 'files': ['iso/fix_default_repos.py'], 'message': 'Replace default release repos instead of append

Fuel deployment script should replace default

Change-Id: I61e9185d6a4fca07d885994b12ad6864f192b04f
'}]
commit_message:
Replace default release repos instead of append

Fuel deployment script should replace default
release repos instead of append new repos to
the existent list of repos. Othewise, deployment
will fail if one of the repos unavailable.

Change-Id: I61e9185d6a4fca07d885994b12ad6864f192b04f

subject: Configure tempest in gate-heat-dsvm-functional-*
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-01 05:19:27.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/heat.yaml'], 'message': "Configure tempest in gate-heat-dsvm-functional-*

While heat transitions to using a tempest plugin to run
heat_integrationtests, this change configures tempest but doesn't run
it.

At first tempest will be invoked by post_test_hook, but later these
jobs could become standard gate-tempest-dsvm-heat jobs. This won't be
practical until the heat devstack plugin work is complete.

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: I409722c9d0f41eaf9b0cc84802b8bda7a8642788
"}]
commit_message:
Configure tempest in gate-heat-dsvm-functional-*

While heat transitions to using a tempest plugin to run
heat_integrationtests, this change configures tempest but doesn't run
it.

At first tempest will be invoked by post_test_hook, but later these
jobs could become standard gate-tempest-dsvm-heat jobs. This won't be
practical until the heat devstack plugin work is complete.

blueprint tempest-plugin-support

Change-Id: I409722c9d0f41eaf9b0cc84802b8bda7a8642788

subject: [Urgent]Fix the integration test failure casused by http header processing
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-11 06:33:39.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/cinder_apigw/controllers/volume.py', 'tricircle/common/httpclient.py'], 'message': '[Urgent]Fix the integration test failure casused by http header processing

1.What is the problem:
Python requests lib is used to forward the http request from the Cinder
API-GW to bottom Cinder. Now the latest version of the requests lib
add stricter header validity check: only bytes or string is allowed for
header item's value, other value will lead to exception, even for "None".
But Cinder client will pass some header items with "None" value in the
api request to Cinder API-GW, thus lead to the exception in Cinder API-GW
when forwarding the request to the bottom Cinder via requests lib, which
lead to the integration failed, and block any patch to be merged.

2.What's need to be fixed:
Remove(clean) the invalid header items in the request to the bottom
Cinder, in which the python requests lib is used. So that integration
test can pass, and make patch being able to be merged.

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
Fix the integration test failure issue casued by strict validity check
in http header processing.

Change-Id: Iff6d2dd77571180ef9a0cad2171c479be63bd880
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[Urgent]Fix the integration test failure casused by http header processing

1.What is the problem:
Python requests lib is used to forward the http request from the Cinder
API-GW to bottom Cinder. Now the latest version of the requests lib
add stricter header validity check: only bytes or string is allowed for
header item's value, other value will lead to exception, even for "None".
But Cinder client will pass some header items with "None" value in the
api request to Cinder API-GW, thus lead to the exception in Cinder API-GW
when forwarding the request to the bottom Cinder via requests lib, which
lead to the integration failed, and block any patch to be merged.

2.What's need to be fixed:
Remove(clean) the invalid header items in the request to the bottom
Cinder, in which the python requests lib is used. So that integration
test can pass, and make patch being able to be merged.

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
Fix the integration test failure issue casued by strict validity check
in http header processing.

Change-Id: Iff6d2dd77571180ef9a0cad2171c479be63bd880
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

If the instance was booted from volume, then rebuild will only change
the image, but the instance will still boot from the original volume.

Create a new volume from the image then replace the old root volume

Change-Id: Iaf7beff4b100dfe951891136e4f95e7cc2cf2680

commit_message:
Replace root volume during rebuild

If the instance was booted from volume, then rebuild will only change
the image, but the instance will still boot from the original volume.

Create a new volume from the image then replace the old root volume
with it. In case of evacuation leave the root volume untouched.

Change-Id: Iaf7beff4b100dfe951891136e4f95e7cc2cf2680
Closes-Bug: #1482040
Closes-Bug: #1378689
Closes-Bug: #1474253

commit_message:
Fix network_for_ssh config option help

The help for the network_for_ssh option says it's not used
if run_validation=False, but that's not true in the case of
scenario tests, so remove that part of the help.

Change-Id: I938afb1589ed4bb56504258e7fa285b19f772a16

commit_message:
Cascade deletion added

Cascade deletion added to all models except hierarchy levels.
SQLite support removed. We don't plan to use SQLite at all.
Alembic migrations used for clean database in tests.
Actual value of table prefix fixed. It was empty in tests.
Tests with hardcoded ids fixed.
Tests with checking vaulues in lists fixed.

Change-Id: I41e280bbe9964c53ed8c291ad3715154352b379d

Implements: blueprint consistency-file-rename

commit_message:
[ops-guide] Changed underscore to hyphen in RST files

This patch:

- renames all the RST files in the ops-guide folder to use a
  hyphen instead of underscore;
- adds redirects to the renamed files to .htacces;
- removes /([a-z-]+) from Admin Guide redirects in .htacces.

Change-Id: I4c35a4c89ae9900a2e9bfe1a7a3bcb94ab72454b
Implements: blueprint consistency-file-rename

subject: fix heat-translator gate failures
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-11 07:10:47.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'fix heat-translator gate failures

Currently, the heat-translator project has a job that is failing [1],
this happened after the job was renamed (the new job now has
"ubuntu-xenial" added to the name. This causes problems with the python
interpreter since it has a limit of 127 characters.

This patch will change the job name to be shorter, it should not impact
the gate since it is currently a non-voting job anyway.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/26/352126/2/check/gate-heat-translator-tox-py27-tosca-parser-master-ubuntu-xenial/a156262/console.html

Change-Id: I0a44bf05b24a66a76c9dac3f262991c894677ceb
'}]
commit_message:
fix heat-translator gate failures

Currently, the heat-translator project has a job that is failing [1],
this happened after the job was renamed (the new job now has
"ubuntu-xenial" added to the name. This causes problems with the python
interpreter since it has a limit of 127 characters.

This patch will change the job name to be shorter, it should not impact
the gate since it is currently a non-voting job anyway.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/26/352126/2/check/gate-heat-translator-tox-py27-tosca-parser-master-ubuntu-xenial/a156262/console.html

Change-Id: I0a44bf05b24a66a76c9dac3f262991c894677ceb

Until zuulv3 lands, we are limted to 127 chars for tox jobs.  Reduce
the name of the jobs to ensure tox works properly.

Change-Id: I5a0341b0e3e6102e6ba55705ea145eede321aa41
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce name for python-tripleoclient buildimages

Until zuulv3 lands, we are limted to 127 chars for tox jobs.  Reduce
the name of the jobs to ensure tox works properly.

Change-Id: I5a0341b0e3e6102e6ba55705ea145eede321aa41
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Don't stop vms if instances in error state

* if there error instances on host for stop then raise
exception with described problem
* Change call for get all active instances on current host
* change test on shutoff_vms

Change-Id: I58d2784228d39c6e9531df6ac2ced9350d75cd51

commit_message:
Don't start evacuation if instances in error state

* if ther are instances in error state on evacuated host then don't
start evacuation on raise exception with described problem
* add test  on host_evacuation

Change-Id: Ic6f6bc6c1749ff794e1871511939d18f44a8fccf

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-05 14:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Set migration status to 'error' on live-migration failure

(A) In resize, confirm-resize and revert-resize operation, migration status
is marked as 'error' in case of failure for respective operation.

Migration object support is added in live-migration operation, which mark
migration status to 'failed' if live-migration operation fails in-between.

To make live-migration consistent with resize, confirm-resize and revert-
resize operation, it needs to mark migration status to 'error' instead of
'failed' in case of failure.

(B) Apart from consistency, proposed change fixes issue (similar to [1])
which might occur on live-migration failure as follows:
If live-migration fails (which sets migration status to 'failed') after
copying instance files from source to dest node and then user request for
instance deletion. In that case, delete api will only remove instance
files from instance.host and not from other host (which could be either
source or dest node but not instance.host). Since instance is already
deleted, instance files will remain on other host (not instance.host).

Set migration status to 'error' on live-migration failure, so that
periodic task _cleanup_incomplete_migrations [2] will remove orphaned
instance files from compute nodes after instance deletion in above case.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1392527
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219299/

DocImpact: On live-migration failure, set migration status to 'error'
instead of 'failed'.

Change-Id: I7a0c5a32349b0d3604802d22e83a3c2dab4b1370
Closes-Bug: 1470420
"}]
commit_message:
Set migration status to 'error' on live-migration failure

(A) In resize, confirm-resize and revert-resize operation, migration status
is marked as 'error' in case of failure for respective operation.

Migration object support is added in live-migration operation, which mark
migration status to 'failed' if live-migration operation fails in-between.

To make live-migration consistent with resize, confirm-resize and revert-
resize operation, it needs to mark migration status to 'error' instead of
'failed' in case of failure.

(B) Apart from consistency, proposed change fixes issue (similar to [1])
which might occur on live-migration failure as follows:
If live-migration fails (which sets migration status to 'failed') after
copying instance files from source to dest node and then user request for
instance deletion. In that case, delete api will only remove instance
files from instance.host and not from other host (which could be either
source or dest node but not instance.host). Since instance is already
deleted, instance files will remain on other host (not instance.host).

Set migration status to 'error' on live-migration failure, so that
periodic task _cleanup_incomplete_migrations [2] will remove orphaned
instance files from compute nodes after instance deletion in above case.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1392527
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219299/

DocImpact: On live-migration failure, set migration status to 'error'
instead of 'failed'.

Change-Id: I7a0c5a32349b0d3604802d22e83a3c2dab4b1370
Closes-Bug: 1470420

commit_message:
Handle deleted ports when creating a list of fdb entries

The issue might happen when VMs are intensively created/deleted.
With the patch deleted ports will be just skipped.

Closes-Bug: #1610303
Change-Id: I32b0de9c452cf973d687c72e8381584012c9f3b4

commit_message:
Remove Compute role parameters from overcloud.yaml

To enable custom-roles we need to pass these directly into th
role template (where these are already defined with the same
names).  The remaining parameters which will be removed in
subsequent patches, as some will require additional work to
ensure backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I5a7e4f12aa7b9697086c1e19a4f7fcb24198c1d4
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

Using the DPDK datapath with Open vSwitch is essentially a trivial
matter today, with one exception: large pages are required on the
guest. Document this feature, including basic requirements and any
other relevant information.

Change-Id: I2747182d5cc2d6d7ccf4c8e86ed52554c61e7dad
'}]
commit_message:
[network] Document OVS-DPDK support

Using the DPDK datapath with Open vSwitch is essentially a trivial
matter today, with one exception: large pages are required on the
guest. Document this feature, including basic requirements and any
other relevant information.

Change-Id: I2747182d5cc2d6d7ccf4c8e86ed52554c61e7dad

commit_message:
Fix adds update for a new field job_settings

For now we don't have a way for cases filtering,
for example we want to filter cases of master
node installation.
As the one way of such filtering is compare
jobs variables, but at first we should store
jenkins variables in case result

Closes-Bug:1601819
Change-Id: Ie62b546bbffbfa3636fff54b2fca644b448ffb01

commit_message:
[user-guide] Changes underscore to hyphen in RST files

Adds the following changes:

- Renames all the RST files in the user-guide folder to use
  hyphens instead of underscores;
- Adds redirects to the renamed files to .htaccess.

Change-Id: Ic5f1a90421add35d001363cd39bada0b56a04d7f
Implements: blueprint consistency-file-rename

commit_message:
Disable old DSE code

- Move tests2 to tests
- Disabled a few tests that require porting to new DSE
  and marked with TODO(dse2)
- Removed all the distributed_architecture checks
- Fixed api_driver_model and upgraded tests to dist_arch

Still need to remove dse code and deal with fallout
Still need to remove dead code from some api models
But this patchset is large enough, so save rest for
future work.

Change-Id: Ia7688b86186e321cfd349ebae1f2ec6c9068616c

subject: Fix preseed script for the brave new world
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-23 15:59:52.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/prepare_tempest_testrepository.py'], 'message': "Fix preseed script for the brave new world

Ever since we started populating the subunit2sql db with data from all
gate and periodic jobs this script has been kinda useless. This was
added with the intent to preseed tempest runs with data from past runs
to hopefully have a positive impact on the testr scheduler. (its
actual usefulness is limited because of bug 1416512 and other
scheduler limitations) However, because we're not filtering now we
end up preseeding tempest runs with data from things like zuul unit
tests which are just a waste. This commit adds the necessary
filtering to the DB queries to ensure we only preseed with data
from previous tempest runs.

Note: For this patch to work the depends-on below must be included in
a subunit2sql release

Change-Id: I32866d63b5f0fa406213709fc88a9029d0318645
Depends-On: Id6ca7e7a4cd1f913d9f84efae5f48d247dd9ed64
"}]
commit_message:
Fix preseed script for the brave new world

Ever since we started populating the subunit2sql db with data from all
gate and periodic jobs this script has been kinda useless. This was
added with the intent to preseed tempest runs with data from past runs
to hopefully have a positive impact on the testr scheduler. (its
actual usefulness is limited because of bug 1416512 and other
scheduler limitations) However, because we're not filtering now we
end up preseeding tempest runs with data from things like zuul unit
tests which are just a waste. This commit adds the necessary
filtering to the DB queries to ensure we only preseed with data
from previous tempest runs.

Note: For this patch to work the depends-on below must be included in
a subunit2sql release

Change-Id: I32866d63b5f0fa406213709fc88a9029d0318645
Depends-On: Id6ca7e7a4cd1f913d9f84efae5f48d247dd9ed64

commit_message:
Add template validation support to orchestration

This patch adds the support to validate stack templates based on V1
API[1]. Due to the design of the API, it is not like any of a regular
resource you will operate in other services. We have to live with it.

[1]
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/orchestration/v1/index.html?expanded=#validate-template

Change-Id: I2277943d2413459d84a0041ef6eeb2506b2611a6

commit_message:
install python-openstackclient from pip and not from package

* the packaged version of python-openstackclient for ubuntu and centos are quite
  old and we need the new version to completely switch all cookbook logic to the
  openstackclient
* this patch include the poise-python cookbook and uses its resources to install
  a python 2 environment and the python-openstackclient

Change-Id: I881075dcd11d06d9c1537d929c7626155c01a1d6

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-11 01:35:02.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/volume/v2/test_backup.py', 'openstackclient/volume/v1/backup.py', 'openstackclient/volume/v2/backup.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-backup-snapshot-renamed-for-volume-resource-2d2d13ea8489a61f.yaml', 'setup.cfg', 'doc/source/command-objects/backup.rst', 'doc/source/command-objects/volume-backup.rst'], 'message': 'Rename backup commands in volume v1 and v2

Backup commands are used only in volume service now,
but "backup" is too generic, users may not know the

Co-Authored-By: Sheel Rana <ranasheel2000@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Rename backup commands in volume v1 and v2

Backup commands are used only in volume service now,
but "backup" is too generic, users may not know the
commands are used for volume from the commands name.
By seeing the command name, users can only see the
"backup" but do not know which object the backup
commands work for. It may confuse users. I think
rename "backup" to "volume backup" can depict resource
relation and will be helpful for users to know the
commands clearly.

So add new commands ``volume backup create/delete/
list/show/restore`` to replace the old commands
``backup create/delete/list/show/restore``. And also
deprecate old commands.

Change-Id: I4f844d9bc48573eb4d17288ce6b8a90cea00d16a
Implements: bp backup-snapshot-renamed-for-volume-resource
Co-Authored-By: Sheel Rana <ranasheel2000@gmail.com>

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 13063, 'name': 'WEI CHEN', 'email': 'dave.jungler@gmail.com', 'username': 'wei.d.chen'}, {'_account_id': 13478, 'name': 'Boris Bobrov', 'email': 'b.bobrov@sap.com', 'username': 'bbobrov'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 20146, 'name': 'yuyafei', 'email': 'yu.yafei@foxmail.com', 'username': 'yuyafei'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-11 01:46:03.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/tests/unit/test_base.py', 'keystoneclient/base.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__
Also fixes spelling errors:resoruces.

Change-Id: Iae4ce0fe84fae810711cc8c3fdb94eb9ca1d772e
Closes-Bug: #1586268
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining
__eq__(), one should also define __ne__() so that the operators
will behave as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__
Also fixes spelling errors:resoruces.

Change-Id: Iae4ce0fe84fae810711cc8c3fdb94eb9ca1d772e
Closes-Bug: #1586268

subject: Correct filters for resource search
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 11:10:44.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/api.py', 'heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_resources.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Correct filters for resource search

We can search resources using this filter keys:
type, status, name, action, id, physical_resource_id. For more
information please see heat-stack-resource-search spec in heat-specs
repository and this commit: Iaae88f3b32bc2ba7b41a4078ef3aa8ffc07079b7
We pass `filters` as an argument to sqlalchemy that expects
filters keys to be a columns in a table. There are not such
columns `physical_resource_id`, `type` in Resource table, so
we get error while trying to filter resource by this keys.
Use `nova_instance` instead of `physical_resource_id` and filter
by `type` manually.

Closes-Bug: #1568974

Change-Id: I7b47eae000b244f58a05405746f5fcf9e922aff8
(cherry picked from commit 0321d864438fc0c1685de35df429f17fb810571d)
'}]
commit_message:
Correct filters for resource search

We can search resources using this filter keys:
type, status, name, action, id, physical_resource_id. For more
information please see heat-stack-resource-search spec in heat-specs
repository and this commit: Iaae88f3b32bc2ba7b41a4078ef3aa8ffc07079b7
We pass `filters` as an argument to sqlalchemy that expects
filters keys to be a columns in a table. There are not such
columns `physical_resource_id`, `type` in Resource table, so
we get error while trying to filter resource by this keys.
Use `nova_instance` instead of `physical_resource_id` and filter
by `type` manually.

Closes-Bug: #1568974

Change-Id: I7b47eae000b244f58a05405746f5fcf9e922aff8
(cherry picked from commit 0321d864438fc0c1685de35df429f17fb810571d)

commit_message:
Updates Development Environment Docs

Now that we support other-requirements.txt and there is a Project Team
Guide doc [1] on how to set a Python environment up for development, we
can take benefit of them and make our docs more concise.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/project-setup/python.html

Co-Authored-By: Hidekazu Nakamura <hid-nakamura@vf.jp.nec.com>

Change-Id: Idcfadb7922b75464af430264e55aadc442e1b0a8

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-01 20:08:13.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/local_dev/lvm.py', 'os_brick/tests/local_dev/test_brick_lvm.py', 'os_brick/exception.py'], 'message': "Remove race condition from lvextend

Currently it's possible for extend_volume in lvm to return
from the deactivate_lv call and try to extend the volume before
the lv has actually been deactivated. This patch adds logic to
make sure that the lv is deactivated before returning from
deactivate_lv.

Change-Id: I5c3671043df6e7474acdfcce342d655ac215a461
Closes-bug: #1495560
"}]
commit_message:
Remove race condition from lvextend

Currently it's possible for extend_volume in lvm to return
from the deactivate_lv call and try to extend the volume before
the lv has actually been deactivated. This patch adds logic to
make sure that the lv is deactivated before returning from
deactivate_lv.

Change-Id: I5c3671043df6e7474acdfcce342d655ac215a461
Closes-bug: #1495560

subject: Correct reraising of exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 13:41:05.000000000', 'files': ['smaug/services/protection/flows/create_restoration.py', 'smaug/services/protection/bank_plugins/swift_bank_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Correct reraising of exceptions

There were a couple instances where an exception was being reraised
by calling "raise ex". This actually causes issues with the traceback
when the exception is passed to the raise call. The correct way is to
just call "raise" by itself.

Change-Id: Ia49a2d1b1b1ca32fbd6897ed66b00dd56d03b3eb
'}]
commit_message:
Correct reraising of exceptions

There were a couple instances where an exception was being reraised
by calling "raise ex". This actually causes issues with the traceback
when the exception is passed to the raise call. The correct way is to
just call "raise" by itself.

Change-Id: Ia49a2d1b1b1ca32fbd6897ed66b00dd56d03b3eb

commit_message:
Remove ReplicationController object

Following the removal of service [1], pod [2] and container [3], remove
COE specific object ReplicationController.

This change also removes k8s_conductor.

[1] I4f06bb779caa0ad369a2b96b4714e1bf2db8acc6
[2] I8c2499ccb97aae39d80868ce02fbef292d762c10
[3] I288fa7a9717519b1ae8195820975676d99b4d6d2

Change-Id: Ica100c8d2dfdd7dc709feb1f5cdc5a3f3d6c7318
Partially-Implements: blueprint delete-container-endpoint
Partially-Implements: blueprint bay-drivers

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 17:24:04.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_enginefacade.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py'], 'message': 'Add test helpers to enginefacade

patch_engine(), to provide support to test fixtures that

commit_message:
Add test helpers to enginefacade

Adds new methods make_new_manager(), patch_factory(),
patch_engine(), to provide support to test fixtures that
wish to generate new managers from an existing one, and to
cross-patch managers, factories and engines into other managers.

Change-Id: I83c6296d992f08117fff1438bc079bbf71db787b

The race condition happened between L2 agent and neutron server
side ml2 plugin for updating a port status. For instance, when
L2 agent, in one network node with L3 agent, try to get port
details, ml2 plugin will try to get/update a HA port, but the
HA port was deleted by a router delete API concurrently, then
ml2 plugin will get some DBError or not be able to update HA
port status.

This patch will retry on update_port_status when it encounter

'}]
commit_message:
ML2: Avoid race condition between port delete and status update

The race condition happened between L2 agent and neutron server
side ml2 plugin for updating a port status. For instance, when
L2 agent, in one network node with L3 agent, try to get port
details, ml2 plugin will try to get/update a HA port, but the
HA port was deleted by a router delete API concurrently, then
ml2 plugin will get some DBError or not be able to update HA
port status.

This patch will retry on update_port_status when it encounter
the DBError exception.

Change-Id: I41e199f9b8ece53819e32303401052fd0479575b
Closes-Bug: #1533443
Related-Bug: #1523780

commit_message:
Add additional test coverage

Currenlty, a large chunk of the playbook logic
used to deploy and configure tempest is not covered
in this role's testing.

This patch copies os_nova's testing environment
settings to deploy additional services.

Change-Id: Ide4764609488b157a1540d1f8828d067faeafdb8

commit_message:
Rebase orchestration to resource2/proxy2

This patch rebases the orchestration resources to resource2 and proxy2.
To make the orchestration service work, some methods from the base
resource2.Resource class are modified to allow passing of additional
parameters. These modifications are mainly due to the asymmetry of Heat
API design. We are trying to avoid overriding the whole method in
sub-classes in these changes.

Change-Id: I71372bb81351e0c83a1e013e50ba2c10cd984ed1

subject: www: Use Redirect directive instead of RedirectMatch for exact links
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 14:29:10.000000000', 'files': ['www/static/.htaccess'], 'message': 'www: Use Redirect directive instead of RedirectMatch for exact links

If regular expression match for URL is unnecessary,
there is no reason to use RedirectMatch.
We can also avoid unnecesary/unexpected redirection
and it is better from performance perspective.

This commit also updates the existing redirct related to
the admin guide so that we can avoid double redirection.

Change-Id: Ib5df7a9255e26fad3364a08daf7cec0f23c8aa65
'}]
commit_message:
www: Use Redirect directive instead of RedirectMatch for exact links

If regular expression match for URL is unnecessary,
there is no reason to use RedirectMatch.
We can also avoid unnecesary/unexpected redirection
and it is better from performance perspective.

This commit also updates the existing redirct related to
the admin guide so that we can avoid double redirection.

Change-Id: Ib5df7a9255e26fad3364a08daf7cec0f23c8aa65

commit_message:
Fix reference to nonexistent ssh_connect_method in config help

The compute.ssh_connect_method option was replaced by the
validation.connect_method option. There is another option's
help which references ssh_connect_method though so this
cleans that up to avoid further confusion.

Change-Id: Ifb71314badcb41190cdaa0c4e780c0c5583f0c7b

When max_over_subscription_ratio is 2.0 the pool are oversubscribed
by a factor of 2, or 200% over subscribed.  The reserved_percentage
is the high water mark where by the physical remaining space cannot
be exceeded.  For example, if there is only 4% of physical space left
and the reserve percentage is 5, user would not be permitted to
provision a volume.  This is a safety mechanism to prevent a scenario

Implements: blueprint vmax-oversubscription

commit_message:
EMC VMAX - Oversubscription support

When max_over_subscription_ratio is 2.0 the pool are oversubscribed
by a factor of 2, or 200% over subscribed.  The reserved_percentage
is the high water mark where by the physical remaining space cannot
be exceeded.  For example, if there is only 4% of physical space left
and the reserve percentage is 5, user would not be permitted to
provision a volume.  This is a safety mechanism to prevent a scenario
that a provisioning request failing due to insufficient raw space.

Change-Id: I55614d05701d461d4b0b85f6f57c49d98b014641
Implements: blueprint vmax-oversubscription

subject: Ignore nova deleting state changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-10 15:33:34.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/notification_handler.py', 'searchlight/listener.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/base.py'], 'message': "Ignore nova deleting state changes

Treats the final two state transitions during server deletion
as a state change and ignored respectively. Adds more information
to the log message for nova servers, and adds a 'finished' log
message to assist with multithreaded debugging.

Marking this as partial because I think there is still an underlying
issue; the error state happens when the 'shutdown.end' event takes
longer to process than the 'delete.end' (which is always) AND some
confluence of timing happens such that the indexing operation for the
shutdown event manages to get past the conflict resolution.

Partial-Bug: #1588501
Change-Id: If6aebbe08d536c63be65f5cb6f550393077071ae
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore nova deleting state changes

Treats the final two state transitions during server deletion
as a state change and ignored respectively. Adds more information
to the log message for nova servers, and adds a 'finished' log
message to assist with multithreaded debugging.

Marking this as partial because I think there is still an underlying
issue; the error state happens when the 'shutdown.end' event takes
longer to process than the 'delete.end' (which is always) AND some
confluence of timing happens such that the indexing operation for the
shutdown event manages to get past the conflict resolution.

Partial-Bug: #1588501
Change-Id: If6aebbe08d536c63be65f5cb6f550393077071ae

subject: rt: Pass nodename to internal RT methods
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-11 01:02:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "rt: Pass nodename to internal RT methods

The end goal of this patch series is to remove the resource tracker's
nodename attribute and have the resource tracker treat Ironic baremetal
resource nodes like any other consumable resource in the system. Before
we get to that point, though, we need to perform some surgery on the
resource tracker to pass a nodename parameter to a number of methods so
that it is not only capable of handling a single Ironic baremetal node.

The first one up is the simple internal methods:

- _set_instance_host_and_nodename()
- _create_migration()
- _claim_existing_migration()
- _move_claim()

Change-Id: Ic6c2a1a4d8180570502810699a09165ffeb1acfc
"}]
commit_message:
rt: Pass nodename to internal RT methods

The end goal of this patch series is to remove the resource tracker's
nodename attribute and have the resource tracker treat Ironic baremetal
resource nodes like any other consumable resource in the system. Before
we get to that point, though, we need to perform some surgery on the
resource tracker to pass a nodename parameter to a number of methods so
that it is not only capable of handling a single Ironic baremetal node.

The first one up is the simple internal methods:

- _set_instance_host_and_nodename()
- _create_migration()
- _claim_existing_migration()
- _move_claim()

Change-Id: Ic6c2a1a4d8180570502810699a09165ffeb1acfc

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-04 19:37:49.000000000', 'files': ['features.yaml', 'devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Enabling Cinder multinode testing

Cinder team is planning to start multinode testing in Newton cycle. We
want to be able to test volume migration/retype and partial grenade.

This commit enables c-vol and c-bak on the subnode in regular multinode
setups (this should work as I4d2960d92f388ac689dfa6b436dc8bfc1e129fbf is

multinode grenade jobs that will test compatibility of master c-api and
c-sch with stable c-vol and c-bak.

commit_message:
Enabling Cinder multinode testing

Cinder team is planning to start multinode testing in Newton cycle. We
want to be able to test volume migration/retype and partial grenade.

This commit enables c-vol and c-bak on the subnode in regular multinode
setups (this should work as I4d2960d92f388ac689dfa6b436dc8bfc1e129fbf is
merged now). Also a new features.yaml elements are introduced that would
disable c-vol and c-bak on primary node. This will be required for
multinode grenade jobs that will test compatibility of master c-api and
c-sch with stable c-vol and c-bak.

Co-Authored-By: Karthik Prabhu Vinod <karthik.prabhu.vinod@intel.com>

Change-Id: I4532bdcfa845cf0a405f68371c61559b0a70f9c1

commit_message:
Change external_network_bridge default to ''

This changes the default for external_network_bridge to '' to
encourage operators to deploy L3 agents in the correct manner.

This patch also adds a functional test to ensure that namespaces
with an existing external gateway interface are not torn down and
rewired on change.

Closes-Bug: #1563070
Change-Id: If533cf7c4c379be78f5a15073accaff7f65973ab

commit_message:
Use the aodh_plugin parameter to toggle aodh tempest plugin

The aodh tempest plugin doesn't use the "service_available/aodh"
parameter but rather the "service_available/aodh_plugin"
parameter - make sure we configure both as required.

Change-Id: Icbd8b5a6803511b27b49c15050b7178954e40def
Related-Bug: #1611406

commit_message:
change nova_cert config to default False and deprecate it

With nova_cert service going away post newton, we should change to a
sensible default here. Once this is in place we can update devstack to
set this on branches we still care about validating it.

Change-Id: I3253deb3d11309358ce83410d45d66252943f241

subject: secure_path in sudoers: deal with possible quotes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 13:25:44.000000000', 'files': ['elements/rpm-distro/pre-install.d/00-usr-local-bin-secure-path'], 'message': "secure_path in sudoers: deal with possible quotes

Sometimes the secure_path option value in /etc/sudoers is surrounded by
quotes, in this case the current command creates an invalid entry and
it's not possible to sudo anymore.
This fix adjust the sed command to deal with possible quotes

Change-Id: Ifd6f9e29b3c0d04d6f65d3f55524ad202fb3294e
"}]
commit_message:
secure_path in sudoers: deal with possible quotes

Sometimes the secure_path option value in /etc/sudoers is surrounded by
quotes, in this case the current command creates an invalid entry and
it's not possible to sudo anymore.
This fix adjust the sed command to deal with possible quotes

Change-Id: Ifd6f9e29b3c0d04d6f65d3f55524ad202fb3294e

subject: Repairing Link 404s in the User Guide
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-11 00:14:48.000000000', 'files': ['doc/user-guide/source/dashboard.rst', 'doc/user-guide/source/cli-manage-shares.rst', 'doc/user-guide/source/cli.rst', 'doc/user-guide/source/dashboard-manage-volumes.rst', 'doc/user-guide/source/dashboard-manage-shares.rst'], 'message': "Repairing Link 404s in the User Guide

Several sections in the User Guides are returning a 404. This patch attempts
to solve the broken or missing file content by adjusting the filenames to
reflect the filename consistency changes.

The openstack-manuals/.htaccess file has the appropriate redirects in place
for the file name changes ( '_' to '-'), which might be involved in the
problem However, it is still not completely clear what is causing the
404s. This name change will ideally solve the link problem.

Closes-Bug: #1611792

Change-Id: Idf0781eeac91ec462839168635c11caee7bad383
Implements: blueprint consistency-file-rename
"}]
commit_message:
Repairing Link 404s in the User Guide

Several sections in the User Guides are returning a 404. This patch attempts
to solve the broken or missing file content by adjusting the filenames to
reflect the filename consistency changes.

The openstack-manuals/.htaccess file has the appropriate redirects in place
for the file name changes ( '_' to '-'), which might be involved in the
problem However, it is still not completely clear what is causing the
404s. This name change will ideally solve the link problem.

Closes-Bug: #1611792

Change-Id: Idf0781eeac91ec462839168635c11caee7bad383
Implements: blueprint consistency-file-rename

api-ref: Fix api-ref for routers

Also merge extraroute.inc into routers.inc as it is
an attribute extension to the router resource.

Part of blueprint neutron-in-tree-api-ref

subject: Allow map_replace substitution of network names
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-08-09 13:33:18.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/controller.yaml', 'network/ports/net_ip_map.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'puppet/ceph-storage.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage.yaml'], 'message': "Allow map_replace substitution of network names

To allow per-node data such as bind_ip's to move into the
composable services templates, we do a value substitution
on the config settings hiera map, where e.g internal_api
will be replaced with the NetIpMap IP assigned to that.

To enable subnet/uri lookup via the same method, we add
all the subnet/uri mappings to the main net_ip_map output.

Change-Id: I7850d4dc8bf4db5f7ac6a6b53c1d900b561b4580
"}]
commit_message:
Allow map_replace substitution of network names

To allow per-node data such as bind_ip's to move into the
composable services templates, we do a value substitution
on the config settings hiera map, where e.g internal_api
will be replaced with the NetIpMap IP assigned to that.

To enable subnet/uri lookup via the same method, we add
all the subnet/uri mappings to the main net_ip_map output.

Change-Id: I7850d4dc8bf4db5f7ac6a6b53c1d900b561b4580

commit_message:
rt: Add get_inventory() method for Ironic

Return an empty list for the Ironic virt driver's get_inventory() method
since the nova-compute running the Ironic virt driver doesn't actually
manage any local resources; it proxies all calls to Ironic.

Change-Id: I719f8f0d0cb02f42843b5acf15eec260c6b1a071
blueprint: generic-resource-pools

commit_message:

for the vCenter virt driver's get_inventory() method that represent the
aggregate resource inventories for the vCenter cluster.

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-09 15:05:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'rt: Remove RT.nodename attribute entirely

This patch removes the nodename attribute of the resource tracker by
adding a nodename parameter to RT.update_available_resource(). The
compute manager continues to keep a mapping of nodename to resource
tracker instance. However, that mapping will be removed from the compute
manager in the next couple patches leading ultimately to the situation
where the Ironic virt driver will be the only thing in Nova that deals
with node states.

In the next series of patches, a new get_inventory() virt driver API
method will be introduced for returning the hypervisor-managed "local"
resources in a format that matches the modeling of the new resource
providers DB schema and placement API. The Ironic virt driver's
get_inventory() method will not return anything since the Ironic virt
driver doesn't interface with any hypervisor. Instead, the resource
tracker in nova/compute/resource_tracker.py will query the
get_available_nodes() virt driver API method and deal with each
baremetal resource node as a separate resource provider having an
inventory of 1 of a dynamic resource class. The existing
get_available_resource() virt driver API method will remain for the near
future since both the legacy resource tracking and new resource
providers/placement API inventory management will live side-by-side for
at least the Newton release.

Change-Id: I328e012a7810e754d6ce3ad9546fbabdf840811c
blueprint: generic-resource-pools
'}]
commit_message:
rt: Remove RT.nodename attribute entirely

This patch removes the nodename attribute of the resource tracker by
adding a nodename parameter to RT.update_available_resource(). The
compute manager continues to keep a mapping of nodename to resource
tracker instance. However, that mapping will be removed from the compute
manager in the next couple patches leading ultimately to the situation
where the Ironic virt driver will be the only thing in Nova that deals
with node states.

In the next series of patches, a new get_inventory() virt driver API
method will be introduced for returning the hypervisor-managed "local"
resources in a format that matches the modeling of the new resource
providers DB schema and placement API. The Ironic virt driver's
get_inventory() method will not return anything since the Ironic virt
driver doesn't interface with any hypervisor. Instead, the resource
tracker in nova/compute/resource_tracker.py will query the
get_available_nodes() virt driver API method and deal with each
baremetal resource node as a separate resource provider having an
inventory of 1 of a dynamic resource class. The existing
get_available_resource() virt driver API method will remain for the near
future since both the legacy resource tracking and new resource
providers/placement API inventory management will live side-by-side for
at least the Newton release.

Change-Id: I328e012a7810e754d6ce3ad9546fbabdf840811c
blueprint: generic-resource-pools

commit_message:
rt: Pass nodename into RT.re[build|size]_claim()

Changes the RT's rebuild_claim() and resize_claim() methods to accept a
nodename parameter and not refer to the RT.nodename attribute.

Change-Id: Id6b75099df296028a9ba1969baffe8a46876d537
blueprint: generic-resource-pools

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-09 15:05:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'rt: Pass the nodename to RT.instance_claim()

We want to eventually stop treating the Ironic nodename as a "special"
kind of unicorn resource in the system. To get there, we need to
decouple the (host, nodename) state in the nova-compute resource
tracker. And in order to do that, we first need to stop creating a
resource tracker instance on the nova-compute for every Ironic bare
metal resource node.

So, in this patch we begin that process by changing the RT's
instance_claim() method to have a nodename parameter and use that
parameter instead of the RT's nodename attribute. We can't yet remove
the RT.nodename attribute because resize_claim() and rebuild_claim()
still need to accept a nodename parameter, which we do in the next
patch, followed by a patch that completes the removal entirely of the
need to have multiple resource tracker instances in the nova-compute
manager.

Change-Id: I57786e9ca021f19b3fc364ad43f7eb32cae80149
blueprint: generic-resource-pools
'}]
commit_message:
rt: Pass the nodename to RT.instance_claim()

We want to eventually stop treating the Ironic nodename as a "special"
kind of unicorn resource in the system. To get there, we need to
decouple the (host, nodename) state in the nova-compute resource
tracker. And in order to do that, we first need to stop creating a
resource tracker instance on the nova-compute for every Ironic bare
metal resource node.

So, in this patch we begin that process by changing the RT's
instance_claim() method to have a nodename parameter and use that
parameter instead of the RT's nodename attribute. We can't yet remove
the RT.nodename attribute because resize_claim() and rebuild_claim()
still need to accept a nodename parameter, which we do in the next
patch, followed by a patch that completes the removal entirely of the
need to have multiple resource tracker instances in the nova-compute
manager.

Change-Id: I57786e9ca021f19b3fc364ad43f7eb32cae80149
blueprint: generic-resource-pools

commit_message:
rt: Pass nodename to internal RT methods

The end goal of this patch series is to remove the resource tracker's
nodename attribute and have the resource tracker treat Ironic baremetal
resource nodes like any other consumable resource in the system. Before
we get to that point, though, we need to perform some surgery on the
resource tracker to pass a nodename parameter to a number of methods.
The first one up is the simple internal methods:

- _set_instance_host_and_nodename()
- _create_migration()
- _claim_existing_migraton()
- _move_claim()

blueprint: generic-resource-pools

Change-Id: Idd3b61d987ab509ca11d5faeafb61e2777dc2c1a

commit_message:
api-ref: Rename file names for consistency

- xxxx.inc (API definition) files are renamed to <resources>.inc
  or <extension-alias>.inc.
- Sample file directories are renamed to match xxxx.inc.
- layer3-ext.inc are split into routers.inc and floatingips.inc.

Note that networks-multi-provider-ext.inc, networks-vlan-transparency-ext.inc
and not renamed as they will be merged into networks.inc.

Preparation of API-ref cleanup.

Part of neutron-in-tree-api-ref

Change-Id: I8e266c02af71d5134a40fa187edddbda18700085

commit_message:
api-ref: Move sample JSON files under v2 directory

Previously sample JSON files are placed in the top directory
of api-ref, but they belong to v2 API, so it sounds reasonable
to place them in v2 directory.

Preparation of API-ref cleanup.

Part of blueprint neutron-in-tree-api-ref

Change-Id: I7c63f570507c51526957988f9b21a4244bd6e58a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-09 15:05:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py'], 'message': 'rt: Rename test_tracker -> test_resource_tracker

The previous patch added a unit test that encompassed all the
functionality of the single remaining unit test in
test_resource_tracker.py. We rename test_tracker.py to
test_resource_tracker.py and finally get rid of all the old unit test
code that used the DB and actual functional conductor and RPC services
in the test class setups.

Change-Id: Ic05f589640f4fd7cb691322c366a297e6d3ff1aa
'}]
commit_message:
rt: Rename test_tracker -> test_resource_tracker

The previous patch added a unit test that encompassed all the
functionality of the single remaining unit test in
test_resource_tracker.py. We rename test_tracker.py to
test_resource_tracker.py and finally get rid of all the old unit test
code that used the DB and actual functional conductor and RPC services
in the test class setups.

Change-Id: Ic05f589640f4fd7cb691322c366a297e6d3ff1aa

commit_message:
Attach/detach features implementation

Supported protocols: iSCSI
Current version is tested only on Linux hosts

This patch introduces new CLI commands 'local-attach' and
'local-detach'.

Change-Id: Ibd7616273342ff27628fb4abf48dd16847b2a636

This helps debug the causes of retriable exceptions.
The exception is only logged at debug level so it won't
look like a real error.

Change-Id: Ic58494992ead79f11a83b75c222b1d38047e1367
"}]
commit_message:
Log full exception before retry in decorator

This helps debug the causes of retriable exceptions.
The exception is only logged at debug level so it won't
look like a real error.

Change-Id: Ic58494992ead79f11a83b75c222b1d38047e1367

commit_message:
Bring bluebox-sjc1 online to 1/2 capacity

Now that our DIB images are uploading again to bluebox-sjc1 we can
start launching jobs again. Start with 20 nodes to see how the cloud
preforms.

Add spec for user_id base policy enforcement

This was a feature from Nova legacy API codebase that had 0 testing,
and only hints of documentation. This proposes to bring it back in a
very limited (and deprecated way) for the current code.

commit_message:

The OSC identity v3 functional tests are failing due to [1] which
added 'password_expires_at' to the user object. This patch set
fixes the tests by updating user object fields list to include
'password_expires_at'.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/333360/

subject: Fix Linux bond/slave ifup ordering
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 18:58:24.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py'], 'message': 'Fix Linux bond/slave ifup ordering

The latest version of os-net-config is not reliably enabling bonding
when there are no existing bonds on the system. This is due to an
order-of-operations problem where it tries to bring up the bond
before the slave interfaces. This can result in an error because
the bonding module is not present.

This change activates the bond only after the interfaces have been
activated. This should ensure that the bonding module is loaded.

Change-Id: I62e4b10a88168948ed59170285223fb4f8d8de88
Fixes-bug: 1611471
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Linux bond/slave ifup ordering

The latest version of os-net-config is not reliably enabling bonding
when there are no existing bonds on the system. This is due to an
order-of-operations problem where it tries to bring up the bond
before the slave interfaces. This can result in an error because
the bonding module is not present.

This change activates the bond only after the interfaces have been
activated. This should ensure that the bonding module is loaded.

Change-Id: I62e4b10a88168948ed59170285223fb4f8d8de88
Fixes-bug: 1611471

This PS "daemonizes" Openvswitch components: ovsdb-server,
ovs-vswitchd and neutron-openvswitch-agent. DaemonSet will start these

commit_message:
Introducing DaemonSet for Neutron Openvswitch components

This PS "daemonizes" Openvswitch components: ovsdb-server,
ovs-vswitchd and neutron-openvswitch-agent. DaemonSet will start these
three components on all compute nodes automatically, it will also start
them automatically in case new compute nodes gets introduced into the
cluster (Kubernetes Auto Scaling Up feature).

Change-Id: Ibc06aa57ed84b8a73fc7a3a5dacb57dbdaceff5f
Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-kubernetes

revisions:

In a previous patch, I added --ignore=wrongdistribution to the reprepro
command line. This was a workaround.

This patch makes it possible to avoid it, since openstack-pkg-tools
has now support for --sbuild-chroot-name, which will produce the

Change-Id: I6975c6c6f8e4b8e9f22aa952689601ca2065ed32
'}]
commit_message:
Use --sbuild-chroot-name jessie-newton-backports

In a previous patch, I added --ignore=wrongdistribution to the reprepro
command line. This was a workaround.

This patch makes it possible to avoid it, since openstack-pkg-tools
has now support for --sbuild-chroot-name, which will produce the
correct Distribution: field value in .changes files.

Change-Id: I6975c6c6f8e4b8e9f22aa952689601ca2065ed32

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 15:03:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/attach_interfaces.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_attach_interfaces.py', 'nova/policies/attach_interfaces.py'], 'message': 'Add separate create/delete policies to attach_interface

In the v2 API there were separate policy checks for the attach and
detach interface actions. This allowed deployers to allow one and not
the other. The v2.1 API policy check did not have this split so both had
to be enabled/disabled.

This patch adds additional checks to allow deployers more granular
control.

Change-Id: Icf1f0dd12920a2c6126e52a548f3fa4636b431d6
Closes-Bug: 1610069
'}]
commit_message:
Add separate create/delete policies to attach_interface

In the v2 API there were separate policy checks for the attach and
detach interface actions. This allowed deployers to allow one and not
the other. The v2.1 API policy check did not have this split so both had
to be enabled/disabled.

This patch adds additional checks to allow deployers more granular
control.

Change-Id: Icf1f0dd12920a2c6126e52a548f3fa4636b431d6
Closes-Bug: 1610069

subject: [Verify] Fixing issue with system-wide Tempest installation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-10 10:51:06.000000000', 'files': ['rally/api.py', 'rally/verification/tempest/tempest.py', 'tests/unit/verification/test_tempest.py', 'rally/cli/commands/verify.py'], 'message': "[Verify] Fixing issue with system-wide Tempest installation

The issue was noticed in a Rally docker container. In the docker container,
as we know, Rally is installed in the global system environment. When we try
to execute

 $ rally verify install --system-wide

Tempest installation will be broken on

 $ pip install --no-deps -e ./

because of permission issues. The command requires the 'sudo' prefix. So it
looks like the best solution for resolving the issue is that user will take
care of installing Tempest package like he does for Tempest requirements.

Change-Id: I3c606d1f659600f027ecaf6fe99eae26c329c9a3
"}]
commit_message:
[Verify] Fixing issue with system-wide Tempest installation

The issue was noticed in a Rally docker container. In the docker container,
as we know, Rally is installed in the global system environment. When we try
to execute

 $ rally verify install --system-wide

Tempest installation will be broken on

 $ pip install --no-deps -e ./

because of permission issues. The command requires the 'sudo' prefix. So it
looks like the best solution for resolving the issue is that user will take
care of installing Tempest package like he does for Tempest requirements.

Change-Id: I3c606d1f659600f027ecaf6fe99eae26c329c9a3

subject: Fix boot --nic error message for v2.32 boundary
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 17:53:27.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Fix boot --nic error message for v2.32 boundary

If the --nic args were incorrect the error message said
that nic tags were supported but that's dependent on the
microversion used. This fixes the error message to be
conditional based on the 2.32 microversion. It also pulls
the error message generation out of the loop since it's
static.

Change-Id: I5d71ba7c490aa96f72094398b80af85fcde21ac6
Closes-Bug: #1611454
"}]
commit_message:
Fix boot --nic error message for v2.32 boundary

If the --nic args were incorrect the error message said
that nic tags were supported but that's dependent on the
microversion used. This fixes the error message to be
conditional based on the 2.32 microversion. It also pulls
the error message generation out of the loop since it's
static.

Change-Id: I5d71ba7c490aa96f72094398b80af85fcde21ac6
Closes-Bug: #1611454

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-07-07 17:54:29.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/filter_scheduler.rst', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_compute_capabilities_filters.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/compute_capabilities_filter.py'], 'message': "Allow irrelevant,self-defined specs in ComputeCapacityFilter

For backward compatibility, ComputeCapacityFilter treats extra spec
keys which contain no colons like 'x' the same as 'capabilities:x',
because hoststate doesn't contain attribute like x, this filter always
return False. So it causes conflict with
AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter, and limits user to define extra spec
keys without colons.

This patch solves the conflict and keep it backward compatible.

This patch also joins two lines into one in method host_passes.

Change-Id: Ia9e7c882bcee131e106e67dc46ed9ce1224e4c67
Closes-Bug: #1582589

commit_message:
Allow irrelevant,self-defined specs in ComputeCapacityFilter

For backward compatibility, ComputeCapacityFilter treats extra spec
keys which contain no colons like 'x' the same as 'capabilities:x',
because hoststate doesn't contain attribute like x, this filter always
return False. So it causes conflict with
AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter, and limits user to define extra spec
keys without colons.

This patch solves the conflict and keep it backward compatible.

This patch also joins two lines into one in method host_passes.

Change-Id: Ia9e7c882bcee131e106e67dc46ed9ce1224e4c67
Closes-Bug: #1582589

commit_message:
rt: Move unit tests for update mig usage

There were three remaining unit tests in test_resource_tracker.py's
UpdateUsageFromMigrationsTestCase. This patch moves two of them to
test_tracker.py pretty much as-is and deletes the third which had all of
its code paths fully covered in the existing

Change-Id: I6cf2617acd3932c60618821b6fb453c7a16e20cc

commit_message:
Refactoring config options for wsgi opts

Refactoring neutron wsgi config opts to be in neutron/conf so that all
the configuration options for wsgi reside in a centralized location.
This simplifies the process of looking up the wsgi config opts and
provides an easy way to import.

Change-Id: I6cf2617acd3932c60618821b6fb453c7a16e20cc

commit_message:
Use existing transactions to update port DHCP options

The commit with change id - Ia3e229f86bf66f5b9b0d867ff41f56ed4be2e8f4
is updating the NB DB for  DHCP options rows during port CUD ops
in separate transactions. Instead it can be done in the existing
ovsdb transactions.

Change-Id: If5abebdaf8042296594a98866669cf182d7373a2
Closes-bug: #1608808

subject: Deploy of a VM occasionally fails due to invalid keystone token
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-10 17:51:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/nvram/test_swift.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/nvram/swift.py'], 'message': "Deploy of a VM occasionally fails due to invalid keystone token

Deploy of virtual machine occasionally fails due to invalid/expired
keystone token with swift and this causes the NVRAM data upload
operation to fail with ClientException error. The results object
returned to nova_powervm will have the error information appended
to it by the swiftclient. Hence, we loop through the results
object to see if there's an authentication failure, and if there
is, we'll retry upload operation, this time with a valid keystone token.

Change-Id: I2779ad6340a58f5c58971eb142ec7b0bd76e2016
Closes-Bug: #1607772
(cherry picked from commit 68d31b0cf64bc03d019d3946092f5827e54d01a2)
"}]
commit_message:
Deploy of a VM occasionally fails due to invalid keystone token

Deploy of virtual machine occasionally fails due to invalid/expired
keystone token with swift and this causes the NVRAM data upload
operation to fail with ClientException error. The results object
returned to nova_powervm will have the error information appended
to it by the swiftclient. Hence, we loop through the results
object to see if there's an authentication failure, and if there
is, we'll retry upload operation, this time with a valid keystone token.

Change-Id: I2779ad6340a58f5c58971eb142ec7b0bd76e2016
Closes-Bug: #1607772
(cherry picked from commit 68d31b0cf64bc03d019d3946092f5827e54d01a2)

commit_message:
rt: Remove dup tests in test_resource_tracker

Removes two duplicate unit tests from test_resource_tracker.py.
UpdateUsageFromMigrationTestCase.test_not_resizing_state() was already
wholly duplicated by the test_tracker.TestInstanceInResizeState class.
UpdateUsageFromMigrationTestCase.test_use_most_recent() was already
wholly duplicated by the
test_tracker.TestUpdateUsageFromMigrations.test_duplicate_migrations_filtered()
test method.

Change-Id: I769f6f562a6491352b9131e6f9a3f0db1c268c00
